dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the light of early morning, a young man RUNS along the side of a country road. He has a MILITARY RUCKSACK slung over his shoulders and is wearing an ARMY uniform. The young man’s hair is cropped short and he has an athletic build. Although he is running steadily at a fast rate, the man’s breathing is quiet and regular. The man in the army uniform continues to run as an old PICK-UP TRUCK appears in the distance behind him. INT. ANNA’S CAR - EARLY MORNING —- CONTINUOUS ANNA PETERSON, a pretty 20 year old with dark hair, drives the pick-up truck down the country road. Her eyes are tired and her mascara smeared, as if she has been up all night. Anna looks through her windshield at the man running on the side of the road. He is running in the same direction that Anna is driving, so she sees only his back. Anna frowns slightly at this sight, then continues driving, moving past the young man as he runs along. Glancing at her rearview mirror, Anna watches his figure recede into the distance behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna pulls her truck into the driveway of a single-story house surrounded by fields of dead grass. Two other cars are parked in the driveway, an SUV and a station wagon. Paper HALLOWEEN DECORATIONS hang outside of the house, and a homemade GHOST stands in the front yard, facing the street, its eyes black holes etched into white bedsheet. Anna climbs out of the truck. Behind her, the sun is beginning to rise, filling the sky with pale light. Anna regards the ghost standing in front of her, then heads towards the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna opens the front door to the house and enters, moving quietly, as if trying to not be heard. Anna softly shuts the door behind her. She turns and see her father, SPENCER PETERSON, 40s, seated on the couch in the dim morning light, watching her. He is wearing slacks and a dress shirt and holding a mug of coffee. Anna slumps back against the closed front door, startled.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Oh. Hey. (pause) You’re up early.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: Not really. Where have you been?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I worked late, then went over to Kristen's. I told mom.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: It’s six in the morning, Anna. Anna moves from the door, towards the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Yeah, um. I fell asleep. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: If you're going to stay under our roof, you need to respect our rules. Walking down the hall, Anna replies without looking back.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I said I was sorry. Alone, Spencer stands in the front room, facing the hall. The sound of Anna CLOSING her bedroom door is audible. Spencer turns to the mantle above the fireplace. A plastic jack-o’-lantern sits next to photos of a young man smiling, in various settings. This is CALEB PETERSON. There is a shot of Caleb in a football uniform and, most recently, a posed shot of him in an army uniform, standing with a group of soldiers in front of a military vehicle. An AMERICAN FLAG is folded into a glass frame that hangs over these photos. Spencer exhales, his shoulders slumping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke and Spencer sit across from each other at the dining room table. Luke is eating breakfast cereal. LAURA PETERSON, Anna’s mother, enters the room with a travel mug of coffee, which she sets in front of Spencer.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: There you go.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: Thank you. Laura sits down and begins sipping from a mug of tea.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Do you know when Anna got in last night? I didn’t hear her. Spencer hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: I think I heard her come in just before midnight. Her car’s in the driveway. Laura nods absently. Spencer turns to Luke.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Luke. You asked any girls to the fall dance yet? Luke flushes and looks down at his cereal bowl.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s a no?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I told you, dad. I’m not interested in any of the girls at my school.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: Ah, well. Wait ‘til you get off to college. You done with breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Spencer rises to his feet and kisses Laura on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: See you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Drive safe. Luke gets up from the table, shouldering his backpack.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Bye, mom. Spencer and Luke exit through the front door. For a long moment, Laura stands in the suddenly quiet room, staring off into space. Then she blinks and begins collecting the used dishes from the dining table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura sits on the sofa, in front of the television. The TV set is on off and she is not looking at it, her gaze resting somewhere in the middle of the floor. The doorbell RINGS. Laura looks up, startled. She clumsily rises to her feet, straightens her clothing, then moves to the front door and opens it. The YOUNG MAN in army uniform who Anna saw running is standing on the porch, facing away from the door, as if surveying the front yard. He is still carrying his rucksack, his back to Laura. Laura gasps, her eyes widening. The young man turns to her, smiling politely. He is very good looking, in a boyish way, with very short blond hair. This is DAVID. David takes in Laura’s expression. He frowns, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Mrs. Peterson? Laura blinks, swallowing.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Yes, um, I’m sorry. I just... (trails off) Who are you? David extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: My name is David, Mrs. Peterson. They shake hands, briefly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew your son, Caleb. We served together. We were friends. Laura takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Won’t you come inside?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Thank you, ma’am. That would be nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David sits at the dining room table, his rucksack on the floor next to him. His hands are folded on the table in front of him. He looks around the room with interest. From the kitchen, Laura calls out to him:

dialogues.speaker: LAURA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Are you sure I can’t get you anything?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Maybe just some water would be nice. Laura comes into the room with a glass of ice water, which she hands to David.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you, ma’am. David drinks the water, obviously very thirsty.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: How, um, how did you get here?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I ran. I needed the exercise. (off Laura’s look) From the bus station, I mean. In town.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: But that must be at least twenty miles.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I guess so. Probably about that.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: You ran all that way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma’am. Of course, I didn’t exactly know how far outside of town you all lived when I started. The guy at the bus station who gave me directions made it sound like it was only a mile or two. David smiles ruefully.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: When did you, um, get out?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I was just discharged on Wednesday. I came straight here from Fort Kennilworth.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: You came here first thing?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah. I wanted to come by sooner, but I couldn’t get leave.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Well, I was discharged because I was wounded. I was in a military hospital for a bit, so it wasn’t really the kind of thing I could get leave from. But don’t worry, it was just a bit of shrapnel in my back. I’m right as rain now.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: No, I mean, why, um-

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Oh, why I’m here? Well, like I said, me and your son, Caleb, we were pretty close. I was with him when he died.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: (strained) Oh, really?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yes, ma’am. And one of the things he asked was for me to check on you all. You, and your whole family here. And he wanted me to tell you that he loved you. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He specifically wanted me to tell each one of you that he loved you and that he was thinking of you guys up until the end. I said I’d do that, so here I am. Laura nods slowly.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Would you hold on a moment, please?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Of course. Laura rises from her chair, exiting the room. David drinks from his glass of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a small laundry area, Laura leans over the washing machine, SOBBING, a dish towel clamped tightly over her mouth to muffle the sound. After a moment, Laura straightens, as if trying to compose herself. She rubs her face with the dish towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura enters from the hallway, her face dry but still flushed. David is no longer in the dining room. Laura looks around. David is standing in the front room, his rucksack on the floor next to him, in front of the mantle. He is looking over the photos of Caleb, surveying each one. Laura moves into the room behind David. He turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: That’s me. David points at the photo of the soldiers posing in front of the military truck. Laura moves up closer to look. In the photo, leaning against the tank a few feet away from the other soldiers, is a YOUNGER VERSION OF DAVID, his head shaved. He is squinting into the camera. Laura blinks, examining the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I’1l be.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I remember that day. David looks at the photo in silence for another second, then leans down and lifts his rucksack.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It wasn’t my intention to upset you, ma’am. I probably should have called first, but I don’t own a phone yet and I guess I just wasn’t thinking. I’m going to be on my way, but I’d like it if we could exchange emails or something. As David turns away, Laura reaches out and grabs his arm.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: No! David turns towards her, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Um, Anna, Caleb’s sister, she works nights, so she sleeps late. But I’m sure she'd like to meet you. Won’t you stay a bit longer?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You’re not just saying that to be polite? Because you don’t need to be.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: I’m not. Please stay. It’s nice having you here and I’d like to hear more about... about you and Caleb.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Well. Alright. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - ANNA’S ROOM - MINUTES LATER Anna lies on her bedsheets in her underwear, her eyes closed. The sound of LAUGHTER echoes in the house. Anna's eyes blink open. She looks around, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both David and Laura are sitting on the sofa. Laura is smiling, listing to David tell a story.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: ---and so Caleb and me, we figure, well, that sounds more like a challenge than anything else. So that night, after he falls asleep, we kind of crept over to his cot with a tube of superglue-

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Oh no!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Oh, nah, we didn’t do anything too bad to him - though we could have. Anna enters the room, wearing a short-skirted DINER UNIFORM. David immediately rises to his feet. Anna regards him with confusion.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: There you are! Anna, this is David. David walks over to Anna, extending his hand.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’m very pleased to meet you. Caleb told me a lot about you.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: David just got discharged this week. He was friends with your brother. Anna politely takes David’s hand and releases it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: You knew Caleb?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yes, ma’am. I promised him I’d check in on you guys if anything happened, so, here I am.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: “Ma'am”? Okay. Where do you live?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Well, I’m originally from just outside of Louisville. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I was thinking maybe I’d head down to Miami or Fort Lauderdale, see if I can’t find work as a bartender or something.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: What about your family? Are they in Louisville?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No, ma’‘am. My folks are both gone, and that’s it for me. I didn’t have a big family like you all do.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Oh. I’m very sorry.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Don't be. They died when I was a kid. Long time ago. I don’t remember it or nothin’.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: So where are you staying?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I noticed a motel off the highway on the way here, so I'll likely stay there. And then I’1l be on my way tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Oh, no, no. You'll stay with us while you're here.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) I couldn’t put you all out.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Nonsense. We’d love to have you. We have plenty of room. Why... you could stay in Caleb’s old room. Anna stares at her mother.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We insist.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I won’t argue. Just for tonight, though. Anna clears her throat.  11.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I’ve got to get to the diner. So, um... Nice to meet you, David.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Likewise. Very nice meeting you.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I guess I’1ll see you again later. Anna glances at her mother, then leaves the house through the front door. Laura turns to David.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Let me show you your room. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - CALEB’S BEDROOM - MOMENTS LATER The door to a small bedroom opens and Laura steps inside, followed by David, who surveys the room. The bedroom is adorned with sports posters and trophies, as well as a framed high school diploma. The bed is made. A stack of folded clothes rests on the floor. Laura looks quietly around the room.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: There are clean towels in the bathroom if you’d like to freshen up.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: That would be nice. Laura smiles and moves to exit.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mrs. Peterson. Are you sure you’re comfortable with me staying in here?

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Of course. I mean, it’s not like it’s going to any use. (blinks) It'll be a good thing for us. Laura exits the room, shutting the door behind her. David stands completely still, alone in the bedroom. He then slowly turns, looking around the room.  12. Caleb's old bedroom has a large window, through which trees in the front yard are visible. Power lines lead along the narrow road that passes the house. After a moment, David moves to sit on the bed. He sits without moving, looking straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BELL RINGS and students flood the school hallway, moving to their lockers and exiting the school. Paper Halloween decorations line the walls, and a large orange sign at the end of the hallway reads: “SIGN UP FOR FALL DANCE - MAPLEWOOD BARN, OCTOBER 31st, HALLOWEEN NIGHT!” Luke carries his backpack slung across both shoulders, his thumbs in the straps. Up ahead, three older boys in football jerseys are laughing, two of them shoving each other. Luke lowers his head, looking at the floor as he walks forward. One of the boys, MIKE, a senior, notices Luke slouching towards them. He glances at his friends.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Hey, watch this. The group of seniors part to let Luke walk between them. At the last moment, Mike spins and SHOVES Luke into the wall BY HIS FACE. Luke slumps against the lockers, holding his face. Mike addresses him as they pass by.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fucking pussy. The other two seniors, IAN and JASON, laugh. The three boys continue down the hallway. Luke stays leaning against the wall, holding his face with both hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura sits at the steering wheel of an SUV parked outside the high school. Teenagers boisterously cross the street in front of her vehicle, shouting at each other.  13. The passenger door opens and Luke climbs into the SUV, setting his backpack on the floor. He shuts the door after him and fastens his seat belt.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Hey there. How was your day?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: It was good.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Great. Laura starts the car and pulls away from the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke sits quietly across from David at the dining room table. They are alone in the room. Luke addresses David.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: You knew my brother?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I did, pretty well, yeah. He wanted me to tell you he loved you. There is a short pause.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Oh. Thanks. David and Luke continue to sit in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura and Spencer stand in the hallway nearby, speaking intently in whispers.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: Laura, we can’t just invite a stranger to stay with us, even if he says he was friends with Caleb!

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: He’s in the photo of Caleb’s squad! It’s not like he’s some stranger!

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: What if he’s got the, uh, the P.T.S.D. or whatever it is? A lot of these guys coming back, they have problems.  14.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: That is just great, Spencer. You know, what if Caleb had come back different? Spencer glares at Laura.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: That’s not at all fair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura and Spencer's whispered conversation is just barely audible from the dining room, the words unintelligible. David and Luke sit at the table, as before. David looks towards the hallway as if Laura and Spencer's conversation is clearly audible to him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Your parents are fighting about me.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah. They argue a lot.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Huh. David considers Luke, then points up towards his own eye.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You look like you got hit or something. Luke reaches up self-consciously and touches his face, the side of which is red and swollen, near his eye.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I- I got hit with a football in gym class. I wasn’t paying attention.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: That can happen.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Spencer walks into the dining room from the living room, his shoulders tense. He speaks with flat cheer.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: Okay. Well. We’re very glad to have you here, David. Will you have a beer? I’m having one.  15.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: Suit yourself. Spencer exits the room, towards the kitchen. Laura enters the dining room from the living room.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Dinner will be ready in an hour. Luke, you should do some homework. Luke rises from the table and exits. Laura smiles kindly at David, then moves into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna lies on a blanket that is positioned on the side of a hill, staring up at the night sky. Next to her, ZEKE HASTINGS, mid-20s, lights a marijuana pipe and exhales smoke up into the cool air. Anna’s truck and a van that belongs to Zeke are both parked near a gravel road behind them. MUSIC plays from a tinny battery-powered boombox next to their blanket. Anna checks the time on her cell phone, sighs, and sits up. She begins pulling on her boots.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I’ve got to go home. Zeke offers the pipe to Anna, who shakes her head, tying her bootlaces. Zeke lights it again, inhaling.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: This friend of your brother’s, he sticking around?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I hope not.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Why not? You said you liked him.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I said he seemed nice. That’s not the same thing. Anna finishes tying her boots.  16.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Okay. Why don’t you like him?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I don’t not like him. Zeke rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s just... I mean, you kind of knew Caleb. We’ve all... I know mom and dad have been trying to move on. It’s not like they don’t have enough reminders of him in this town. Hell, they’ve kept that bedroom like a shrine to him.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I mean, that seems normal. Your kid dies. That’s hard.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: We just don’t need a walking, breathing reminder of Caleb hanging around right now, you know?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Totally. Anna turns to Zeke to kiss him goodbye. Zeke embraces her, pulling her back onto the blanket, kissing her again. Anna laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You sure you can’t stay longer?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I’m going to be late as is. But I’m sure we can find some time at the party tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Great. Anna returns Zeke’s smile, then rises from the blanket, grabbing her purse. She crosses behind Zeke, heading to her truck. Zeke watches as Anna climbs inside her pick-up truck. She starts its engine and drives away. Zeke then turns to stare out over the hill, again lighting his pipe.  17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke is doing homework on the living room floor, papers spread in front of him. David sits cross-legged next to Luke.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: The sine is the angle of the ship’s anchor cable, so the cable is the hypotenuse, and what we need to find out is the distance down to the ocean bottom, so that’s the opposite. Do you see?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (amused) Not at all. I was never too good at this stuff, I guess that’s why I went into the military. You don’t need to know much there. Can’t you just punch those numbers into a computer and it’1l do it for you?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Maybe. But it doesn’t take that much longer to just work it out for yourself. Spencer is seated in front of the television, drinking a beer. He glances over, watching David work with Luke.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: So you're kind of smart, huh?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I guess so. I can give you an easy one.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah, no thanks. The front door opens and Anna enters the house. She shuts and locks the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: How did work go?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Good. Not too busy. Spencer finishes his beer and rises to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: David, sure I can’t get you a beer? David looks at Spencer, then nods.  18.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You know, I will have one.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I’1l take one, too.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: Nice try. Spencer turns away.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I’m twenty-one in a month!

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: And you can have all the beer you want then, assuming you buy it yourself. Spencer exits. Anna takes in David and Luke.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Are you helping him with his homework?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Not exactly. Spencer returns, carrying two bottles of beer. David rises and takes one. Anna moves to the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: Stay here, be sociable.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I’m not feeling so great. I think I’m just going to lie down.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: Suit yourself. Anna exits the front room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna enters the hallway, moving towards her bedroom. Anna stops at the door to Caleb’s room. She hesitates. Spencer’s voice can be heard in the front room. David says something imperceptible in reply and Spencer laughs. Anna turns the doorknob to Caleb’s room and steps inside.  19. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - CALEB’S ROOM - NIGHT - CONTINUOUS Anna walks into Caleb’s room, leaving the door behind her open. The room appears much as before. David’s rucksack rests on the floor, mostly empty. Anna looks towards the doorway, then crouches down and peers into David’s rucksack. She reaches inside, searching its contents. The bag contains only undergarments, socks, and a tube of deodorant. Anna straightens up. Anna looks around the room, taking in Caleb’s belongings. She sighs, then sits down on the bed. Anna looks down at the pillow she is sitting on. She shifts her weight and lifts up the pillow. A polished PISTOL is beneath the pillow on Caleb's bed. Anna takes this in, then carefully puts the pillow back into place over the gun, as before. Anna starts to stand up, looking to the door. DAVID IS STANDING in the doorway to the room, WATCHING HER. Anna gasps and quickly stands, taking a step back.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Hey there.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I, um, I’m sorry. I just... I just come in here sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No, it’s okay. I’m sorry to have interrupted you. Don’t mind me. David moves quietly from the doorway, towards the bathroom. Anna rapidly exits Caleb’s bedroom, heading towards her own room. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - ANNA’S ROOM —- CONTINUOUS Anna enters her bedroom, shutting and locking the door behind her. She looks around her room, breathing quickly.  20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spencer and David sit in front of the television, several empty beer bottles in front of them. They are watching a sports show, the volume low. Spencer’s voice is slurred.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: You see, Allan, he’s only been there four years. But since he’s got a degree, suddenly he’s regional manager.I know Laura, she wonders what's going on, if I’m ever going to make any money. Spencer goes silent, immersed in thought.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Your wife seems to respect you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: Yeah. (beat) So what about you? What are your plans?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I haven't really given that much thought. Figured I'd get on a bus tomorrow, head towards Florida and start looking for work. I’ve done contracting work before, I’m sure I could find something.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: That's crazy. You... you should stay with us a couple more days. Look for jobs online.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I couldn’t impose on your hospitality any longer, sir.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: No, that’s... and what’s with this “sir” business? My name’s Spencer.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: Stick around, at least until you know where you’re going. Okay? David looks like he is thinking, then nods.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Maybe just a couple more days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Spencer finishes his beer, then looks at the bottle. David reaches for a bottle on the table and finishes it in several gulps, setting it down.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One more round to celebrate, then I’ve got to get to bed. You can hold your liquor, huh?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I guess so.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: You tired?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No, I don’t need much sleep.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: Well. You have no idea what I’d give to be your age again. Spencer rises to his feet, heading towards the kitchen. David watches him leave. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - CALEB’S ROOM - NIGHT - LATER In Caleb’s bedroom, David lies on the bed, fully dressed. He is visible by moonlight coming in through the window. David lies completely still. A breeze moves the barren branches of the tree outside; they shift, CREAKING. David glances over at this sound. After a moment, David quietly rises from the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dozens of students pour out of the high school at the end of the school day. Luke slouches among them, looking at the ground. Luke glances up, then stops when he sees DAVID SEATED in the driver’s seat of Laura’s SUV at the edge of the school’s parking lot. Luke looks around, then walks over and gets into the car. 21.  22. INT. LAURA’S CAR - DAY - CONTINUOUS Luke shuts the passenger door, glancing over at David.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I told your mom I could pick you up from school today. That cool? Luke nods. David surveys the students exiting the school.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t you, like, have any friends?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I have lots of friends. David looks over at Luke.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just not, like, here. Like, online.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Ah. David continues looking at the kids exiting the school.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Are we going?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: In a little bit.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: What are you waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You should show me who hit you yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I got hit with a football.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah. Luke meets David’s eyes, then lowers his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Nothing bad.  23. Luke looks at David, as if considering. He then points.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Over there. David follows Luke’s gaze. A group of older students, including Mike, Ian and Jason, surround two pick-up trucks in the parking lot, one of their stereos playing loud music.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: All of them?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Well, most of them give me a hard time. Those two guys, Mike and Ian, are the worst. Those guys are real assholes.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Which is which?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Ian's the big one, Mike’s the guy with blond hair. David watches as one of the pick-up trucks is driven away by Jason. Mike and Ian climb into the second truck with their girlfriends.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can we go now?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yes. David starts the car and drives off the parking lot, moving after Mike and Ian’s pick-up truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving Laura’s station wagon, David FOLLOWS the pick-up from a distance, letting some cars get between them. INT. LAURA’S CAR - DAY - CONTINUOUS Luke watches David drive with growing concern. David remains focused on the pick-up truck ahead of them.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: What are you doing?  24. Up ahead, the pick-up turns into the parking lot of a small DIVE BAR. Jason’s pick-up truck is already parked in the lot.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: They’re going to a bar?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, this place will serve you if you’re on the football team.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I could use a drink. How about you?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I could use a drink. David steers the station wagon into the bar’s parking lot. David opens his car door, then looks back at Luke.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You coming?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Well. I’1l be inside if you change your mind. David climbs out of the car and shuts the door. Luke watches him walk to the bar through the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke hesitantly opens the door to the dark bar. It is nearly empty, manned by a lone BARTENDER. David sits alone at a table, facing the back of the bar, drinking beer from a bottle. The only other patrons are two OLDER MEN seated at the bar and a group of FOUR HIGH SCHOOL SENIOR GUYS, including Mike, Ian and Jason, who are gathered with an equal number of GIRLS their age in two booths. David looks up as Luke enters and waves him over.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Luke, over here, man.  25. Luke glances over at the bartender, then makes his way to David's table, head lowered. Music blares from a jukebox in the corner. Mike, Ian and their group stare at Luke.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Look at this shit. What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Maybe that’s his boyfriend or something? Luke ignores this. He sits down across from David.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Hey. David waves the bartender over. The bartender, a man in his 30s, warily approaches their table.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: I’m going to have to see some I.D.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It's fine, he’s my brother, he’s just going to chill with me. Luke gives David a quick look. Off the bartender’s reluctant gaze, David nods over at the booths where the seniors are seated.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you I.D. all of them? The bartender sighs.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: What can I get you?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Do you know how to make a fireball?

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Cinnamon schnapps and Tabasco sauce, yep.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: That’s my drink of choice. Let me get one of those, a coke for my brother, and I can’t help but notice that those ladies over there are drinking cheap beer. That seems like a shame. I'd like to buy them each a blowjob shot. The bartender blinks down at David.  26.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Are you serious? David places a $100 bill on the table.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I am, yes.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Did you want to buy anything for their fellas?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (amused) Do I look like I'd like to buy something for their fellas?

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Might be the polite thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Sure, okay, fine. Okay, I’1l buy each one of those guys there a cosmopolitan.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Ah. I don’t know what you’re going for, but I was thinking a beer.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No. Blowjob shots for the ladies, and a cosmopolitan for each of the guys. David taps the $100 bill on the table, then lays another on top of it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You keep the change on that.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: You got it. The bartender lifts the two bills and quickly heads behind the bar. Luke is regarding David.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Are you, like, rich?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Cash is easy to get. David hums to the music on the jukebox, drumming his fingers on the table. A moment later, the bartender approaches David's table, setting down drinks.  27.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Here’s your coke, and here’s your fireball. Got their shots and cosmos coming right up.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Thanks. The bartender moves back behind the bar. David pushes his fireball shot towards Luke. Its contents are red and cloudy.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You want to try it?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Sure. Luke reaches forward and takes a small sip. He immediately sets the shot down, coughing.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ah! God! Luke reaches for his coke and takes several deep gulps, then sets it down. His eyes are watering.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's like hot peppers. You drink that?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah. David takes a sip from the fireball. It appears to have no affect on him.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: How do you do that?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You get used to it. Behind Luke, the bartender crosses to the booths with a tray filled with drinks. He hands out Irish cream shots to the girls and pink martinis to the guys. The girl seated next to Ian starts laughing loudly. All of the seniors turn to look towards David, who ignores them. Luke watches them apprehensively.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Uh... they look kind of annoyed.  28.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah. You said they play football? Caleb used to play for the same school?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah. He was really good.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: But they still mess with you?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah. The guys at my school hate me.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Why? Luke says nothing. Behind them, Ian rises, holding his cosmopolitan. He walks towards David’s table, followed by another one of the seniors, BLAIR. Luke lowers his head. Ian reaches the table, martini glass in hand. Blair moves to stand behind him. Ian regards the seated David.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: Hey, thanks for the drinks, man.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You're welcome.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: I don’t want it, though. You can have it. Ian FLINGS the contents of his glass into David’s FACE. David sits, the drink running down his face. He calmly wipes his eyes, then reaches for his FIREBALL SHOT.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Ah. Maybe you could try this instead? David lightly tosses the fireball shot into Ian’s face. Ian takes a step back, blinking. Then he SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: IAN
dialogues.text: My eyes! Ian hunches forward, clutching his eyes and HOWLING with pain. Blair moves towards him, confused. David LAUGHS, then rises to his feet. David reaches past Blair and TAPS Ian’s shoulder.  29.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Hey, over here. David ducks back and Ian, blind, SWINGS his fist out. He HITS BLAIR in the face, knocking him to the floor. David again bursts into LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ha. Wow. Okay. David stops laughing. He steps forward and PUNCHES IAN IN THE NECK. Ian DROPS TO THE FLOOR. Mike and Jason are moving towards David, who turns to face them. Jason attempts to tackle David. David brings his knee up into Jason’s face, sending him flying back. Luke is on his feet, but seems to not know what to do. He is abruptly SPUN AROUND by Mike, who PUNCHES LUKE in the face, knocking him to the floor. Luke lies on the floor, dazed. Mike moves to KICK Luke, but is HIT FROM BEHIND WITH A POOL CUE by David. The stick BREAKS across Mike’s back. Mike falls to the ground next to Luke. Through Luke’s blurred vision, he can see David stomping on Mike’s KNEE, then ANKLE. BONES CRACK. Mike SCREAMS. Luke blinks, losing consciousness. Blair staggers to his feet. He grabs an empty beer bottle and swings it down at David’s head. David neatly sidesteps, pins Blair’s arm and pulls the bottle from his grasp. He then SMASHES the bottle across Blair's face, then JABS the BROKEN BOTTLE NECK into Blair's shoulder. Blair looks down, startled. BLOOD is dribbling from the bottle neck protruding from his jersey. Blair’s eyes roll up and he FAINTS, falling to the floor. David looks around the room. Luke, Blair, Jason and Mike are unconscious on the floor; Ian is sobbing underneath a table, holding his eyes. The remaining senior girls are cowering away from David in a booth. David leans down and gently SLAPS Luke’s face.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, Luke. Wake up.  30. Luke’s eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cool. David rises and approaches the bar. The bartender is holding a sawed-off POOL STICK, frozen in place behind the bar. The two old men shrink away from David.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You guys should get out of here. Without a word, the two old men get up and exit. David turns to the bartender, who defensively raises his pool cue. David ignores the weapon.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Call the police and tell them the truth: a gang of high school kids came in here and demanded you serve them drinks. You tried to I.D. them but they threatened to cause trouble. There was a fight. You didn’t really get a good look at the other guys. (considers) Maybe they were from out of town. The bartender looks at David.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Otherwise, I imagine you and this place could get in trouble for serving minors. I mean, this is what happens. Here. David takes two more $100 bills from his pocket and sets them down on the bar.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: For the damages. The bartender hesitates, then lowers his pool stick. David turns and pulls Luke to his feet. They exit, David leading Luke out into the sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David pulls Laura’s SUV into the house’s garage, its automated door closing behind them. He and Luke climb out of the car. Luke winces, touching his head.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Ow. I think I have a concussion.  31.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah, you definitely have a concussion, dude. You were out. David walks to the door leading inside. Luke follows him as they enter the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke and David enter the kitchen. David crosses to the freezer, gathers a handful of ice cubes and drops them into a dishcloth.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Should I go to the hospital?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: For, like, my brain.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Oh. No, it’1ll be fine. I used to get them all the time.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Here. David hands Luke the makeshift ice pack and they walk into the front room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke and David enter the front room. Laura and Anna are seated, Anna sketching in a notebook. Laura rises when she sees Luke holding the ice pack to his bruised face.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Luke! What happened?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I got in a fight with some guys at school.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Are you okay?!  32.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m fine. David helped me out. Anna looks over at David, seeing his bloody knuckles. Without looking at Anna, David puts his hands in his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Some seniors were just picking on me. It happens.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Why were they picking on you?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I’m going to my room, okay? Luke exits. Laura turns quickly to David.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Is he alright?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yes, ma’am, he’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Did he get in any trouble with the school? The police didn’t...?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No, ma’am, no one saw. It’s just the usual high school stuff. I told him I’d teach him some self defense when he’s feeling up to it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) I’m sure that’s exactly what he needs. David looks over at Anna.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Well. I’m relieved you were there. David smiles. Anna, looking annoyed, rises to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I’m going to get ready for Kristen’s.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Anna, can I talk to you for a second?  33. Anna looks at Laura, who pointedly gestures for Anna to join her in the kitchen. Anna exits into the kitchen with Laura. They converse in the kitchen in heated but barely audible whispers. David sits down on the sofa, his face settling into a blank mask. He stares straight ahead. Anna’s VOICE comes from the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Really?! You're going to play that card? Laura’s reply is inaudible. A moment later, Anna storms out of the kitchen. She clears her throat.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: David, would you like to come to a party with me tonight? David looks up at Anna.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Sure, that sounds nice.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: (barely concealed annoyance) Great. I’m going to leave around seven. David rises to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’ll get ready, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna steps into the hall, wearing a small robe and carrying clothes. She looks at the closed bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Great. (calling out) Luke, I need to shower! The bathroom door immediately opens and David steps out in a haze of steam, wearing a towel around his waist. David appears almost unnaturally fit, each muscle defined. His tanned torso is also covered with flushed, thick SCARS from dozens of cuts and wounds.  34. David moves towards the door to Caleb’s room, edging past Anna in the narrow hallway.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I wanted to shave.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: No, I- I’m sorry, I thought Luke was-— Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’m going to go get dressed.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Yeah, um... You do, you do that. As David faces away from Anna to enter Caleb’s room, a clean BANDAGE is visible on his lower back. Anna quickly turns away and moves into the bathroom. INT. Anna her. Anna INT. Anna PETERSON HOUSE - BATHROOM —- CONTINUOUS enters the steamy bathroom and shuts the door behind She leans up against the door and exhales.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Okay. sighs, then turns the shower on.

dialogues.speaker: PETERSON HOUSE
dialogues.text: enters the front room, wearing a black tank top and tights with the outline of a skeleton printed on them. Anna stops when she sees David, who is quietly seated on the couch, waiting for her. He is dressed in a fashionable dress shirt and slacks. David looks at Anna, then down at his own attire.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I, uh, borrowed some of Caleb’s clothes. I hope you don’t mind. He was about the same size as me, and I don’t own much in the way of nice clothing.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: It’s fine. Anna moves towards the front door. David rises.  35.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You look nice.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Thank you. David follows Anna outside. EXT. KRISTEN’S HOUSE - NIGHT - A HALF HOUR LATER David and Anna walk from her car to Kristen’s house, a small, unattractive duplex. Anna turns to face David.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: So, look. This isn’t a big deal or anything, but this isn’t just Kristen’s place. My boyfriend, Zeke, lives here, too.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I didn’t know you had a boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Yeah, well. Neither do my parents. And I wouldn’t mind keeping it that way, at least for now, if it’s alright with you.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I won’t say anything. It’s none of my business. Anna nods gratefully. She rings the DOORBELL. A moment later, KRISTEN, an attractive girl the same age as Anna, opens the front door. Kristen is wearing CAT EARS and a tail. She quickly hugs Anna, then takes in David, who nods politely at her.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: Who’s this?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: This is David, he was friends with my brother, Caleb. I told you about him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: How do you do?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: Fine, thank you. Kristen and David shake hands. Kristen shoots Anna a quick look, but Anna ignores it.  36. INT. KRISTEN’S HOUSE - FRONT ROOM - NIGHT - CONTINUOUS Kristen leads David and Anna into her house, where a small party is underway.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: Zeke’s out back, smoking. He was waiting for help to carry the kegs.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I‘ll bring them in. Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: In Zeke’s van. It should be unlocked. David exits. Kristen leans towards Anna.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I am potentially interested in getting to know your brother's friend.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Have at it.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: Any pointers? Likes or dislikes?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Uh... He was in the army?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: That’s helpful. Come on. Anna and Kristen move through her house. EXT. KRISTEN’S HOUSE - BACK PORCH - NIGHT - MINUTES LATER Anna and Kristen stand outside with Zeke and his friend CRAIG, smoking. Craig offers a blunt to Anna.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Ugh, I wish. I can’t smoke tonight.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: What, your houseguest?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Yeah, he’s-— David emerges from the yard, CARRYING TWO KEGS. He has one propped on his shoulder and is carrying the other with one hand.  37.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I wasn’t sure where you’d want these. Back here? Kristen gives Anna an incredulous look, then quickly turns to David.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: Yeah, here. Hang on, I'll get the tap. Kristen disappears inside as David carefully sets the kegs down. Craig offers David the blunt.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: Hey, man, you want some?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Craig-

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Sure. David takes the proffered blunt and inhales deeply.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you. David passes the blunt back to Craig, who then pointedly offers it again to Anna, who grimaces.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Thanks. Anna takes the blunt and inhales. INT. KRISTEN’S HOUSE - NIGHT - AN HOUR LATER MUSIC blares inside Kristen’s house and a few people are dancing in her living room. Anna watches David from across the room; David is conversing with Kristen. Zeke approaches Anna and hands her a cup of beer.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I’m fine.  38.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: You want to-? Zeke gestures with his head back towards his room. Anna smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay. On the other side of the room, David turns to watch Zeke and Anna exit, then looks back to Kristen.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: -so what I told him was, even if I could still trust you... Oh, goddammit. Kristen trails off, looking at the door. A group of THREE GUYS have walked in, glaring around the party antagonistically. David follows her gaze.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Who are they? One of the guys, DREW, immediately locks eyes with Kristen. He strides towards her.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: Uh, that is my ex. The one I was telling you about. Drew comes up to Kristen and David. He ignores David, his attention on Kristen.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Hey. I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: I’m busy right now, Drew.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: I’ve been calling you all week, then I hear you’re having a party tonight? What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: I’m talking to my friend. You're being rude. Drew GRABS Kristen’s arm, pulling her away from David.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Listen, just come here-  39. David steps forward and GRIPS Drew’s WRIST, TWISTING IT, causing Drew to release Kristen. Kristen takes a step back, wide-eyed. Startled, Drew yanks his arm away from David, facing him. People at the party turn, noticing the altercation. The TWO GUYS Drew came in with MOVE UP behind him. David glances at them, but remains focused on Drew.

dialogues.speaker: DREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fucking asshole. Drew SHOVES David, pushing him back. David shifts his weight slightly, then reaches out, GRABS DREW'S HEAD and SMASHES IT INTO THE WALL, SHATTERING a framed photo. Drew falls to the floor, unconscious. Drew's two friends are frozen, staring at David. David nods at Drew’s prone body.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Get him out of here. The two exchange a look, then lift Drew by his arms and drag him out of the party. There is a round of APPLAUSE from the rest of the party. Craig shouts out:

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: Fuckin’ awesome! David reaches down and picks up the photo he broke with Drew's head. It is a photo of Kristen as a teenager, ina cheerleader uniform. Kristen is staring at David breathlessly. David carefully picks broken glass out of the picture frame.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’m sorry about your photograph. I’1l buy you a new frame.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: No, don’t worry about it. Did you- Did you want to see the rest of the house? David looks at her.  40. INT. KRISTEN’S HOUSE - KRISTEN’S BEDROOM - MOMENTS LATER David and Kristen make out in her bedroom, on her bed, the lights dim. Kristen has her shirt off and is on top of David, kissing him. After a moment, Kristen stops, pulling slightly away.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah. Why?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: Seems like you’re not really into this. David blinks. Then he smiles and, in a swift motion, rolls on top of Kristen, moving against her.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No. I am.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: Oh. You are. David leans down and kisses Kristen’s neck, gripping her wrists and pinning her to the bed. INT. KRISTEN’S HOUSE - FRONT ROOM - NIGHT - LATER David and Kristen emerge from her bedroom and cross to the couch, where Craig is sitting, smoking marijuana. He grins at them.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: There you guys are. Thought you’d left your own party, maybe found a better one. Craig offers the pipe to David while Kristen lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No, I’m good.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: Cool. Hey, I wanted to say to you, man, we're not, like, hippies or anything. I wanted to say, I totally support what you guys are doing over there. You need anything here, you let me know.  41.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Support us how?

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: I mean, like, I believe in what you guys are doing.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: But you wouldn’t support us by, like, enlisting? Craig looks uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: Nah, I mean, like... I’ve got asthma, you know? Makes that kind of like...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (laughs ) I’m just messing with you, man.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: Oh no, cool. I mean, cool, I knew that. Kristen rises from the sofa, patting David’s arm.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: I’ll be right back. David watches Kristen leave. Craig grins again.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: She’s fun, huh?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. (leans forward) Could you get me a gun?

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: (surprised) I mean, yeah, hell yeah. I can get youa gun. What do you need a gun for, man?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’m a soldier, dude. I like guns.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: Sure. I know a guy. It’ll be a few hundred though, more for something fancy. You got cash?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I do.  42.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: Sure. I can set something up. Let me get your number. David pulls out a disposable cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’m using a burner right now. The number’s on the back. David hands the phone to Craig, who punches the number into his own phone.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: Perfect. Anna comes into the party from the hallway, followed by Zeke. They appear to be engaged in heated discussion.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Why is it even a big deal if I go on tour? It’s three weeks, maybe. So what? Anna turns to David.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: David, are you ready to go? David takes his phone from Craig and rises.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Sure. Zeke steps in front of Anna. David watches him.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Look, wait. Can we just talk about this?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I have to go, Zeke. Call me tomorrow. Zeke turns away, exhaling.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Whatever. Zeke exits the room. Anna blinks, then looks to David.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Let’s go, okay? David nods. He shrugs at Kristen, then walks with Anna towards the front door.  43. EXT. KRISTEN’S HOUSE - NIGHT - MOMENTS LATER David and Anna walk to her car. Anna takes her keys out.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’ll drive.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: No, I’m fine. David quickly steps in front of Anna. He touches the side of her face, peering into her eyes. Anna inhales, surprised, but does not shrink away. David moves his hand down and smoothly pulls the keys from her grasp.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’ll drive. You're stoned.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Wait. How are you more sober than me?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’m bigger than you. David unlocks Anna’s car and opens the passenger door for her. Anna hesitates, then climbs inside. INT. ANNA’S CAR - NIGHT - MINUTES LATER David drives quickly, shifting gears. Anna, in the passenger seat, lights a cigarette. David glances at her.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Please put on your seat belt. Anna fastens her seat belt. Her CD of 1980s goth music is playing a slower song. David glances at her.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you want to talk about it?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: No, it’s just... it’s nothing. We had an argument. Old stuff. Zeke... When we first started dating, I loved that he was in a band. But now I’m saving up for college, and he just isn’t moving on, you know? Like, he doesn’t even have a job.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Well, he’s a drug dealer.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: He’s not a drug dealer! (pause) He sells drugs sometimes. Like, to friends, to make extra cash. David reaches up and adjusts the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Well. If he’s messing things up with you, then he’s a fool, and you don’t need to worry about it. Anna makes an incredulous noise. David looks over at her.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m serious. I mean, hell, if I'd hada girl like you back home, you better believe I wouldn’t have gone over to the Middle East to get shot at. Anna looks over at David. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Thanks. David drives in silence for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I like this music.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: You do? It’s just a mix I made. I can make you a CD if you’d like.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Can you put this song on it?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Of course. David steers the car down the narrow road leading to their house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David and Anna walk down the hallway together, towards their bedrooms. They reach the door to Anna’s room first. They stand near each other in the narrow hallway.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: So, uh. Goodnight.  45.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Goodnight. Thank you for inviting me out.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: No, um, no problem. Goodnight. Anna enters her bedroom, shutting the door behind her. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - ANNA’S ROOM - NIGHT - CONTINUOUS Anna stands just inside her bedroom door. She can hear David's footsteps moving away, entering Caleb’s room. Anna sighs and crosses her bedroom, taking off her shirt. She collapses onto her bed, looking up at the ceiling. After a moment, Anna rises from her bed. She moves over to her bookshelf and pulls out a BLANK CD and a marker. Anna writes on the CD: “MIX FOR DAVID.” She then moves back to her bed and opens her laptop. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - ANNA’S ROOM - NIGHT - LATER Anna leans back on her bed, slipping on her headphones. She stares out the window, nodding her head slightly, listening to the mix she just made. Anna smiles slightly, to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the front windows of Anna’s bedroom, she is visible lounging on her bed, listening to her MUSIC loudly on her headphones. Anna shifts her position, closing her eyes. Without opening them, she reaches up over her head and TURNS OFF THE LIGHT. Anna’s room goes dark. In the room next to Anna’s, also visible through the front windows, David sits on Caleb’s bed, perfectly still. He stares out the window, into the darkness outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing an undershirt and pajama pants, Anna walks into the kitchen and starts making herself tea.  46. Glancing outside, Anna sees David pacing in the backyard, speaking into his disposable cell phone. His voice is barely audible from inside.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: An orthodontist? I don’t... No, I don’t need that. Fingers, yes. David turns, pacing as he speaks into the phone. Anna moves to the side of the window, out of view.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As soon as possible. I already feel like I’ve waited too long. Money’s no issue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David continues speaking into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I understand money’s an issue for you. I just meant I have it. (pause) I can be there. I’1l keep this phone in case anything comes up and you need to reach me. Copy. David hangs up. He looks towards the house. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - ANNA’S ROOM - DAY - MINUTES LATER Anna sits on her bed, her netbook propped in front of her. A military webpage is up on the screen. Anna speaks into her cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Yes, his name is David Andersen Collins. I think I can tell you what unit he served in if that helps. (pause) No, nothing’s wrong. He was friends with my brother and we just heard he’s back, so any contact information you could give me would be helpful. (pause) Yes, that’s my cell phone. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman wearing an army uniform, SERGEANT HALWAY, speaks into a telephone headset. She is facing a computer.  47.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. HALWAY
dialogues.text: Okay, ma’am. I’1l call you when I have any information. Goodbye. Sergeant Halway taps a button on her headset, terminating the call. She looks at her computer screen. The screen shows a records search form for a David Andersen Collins, with his rank and Social Security number displayed. Across the screen is a red alert banner that reads: “RECORD CLASSIFIED - CONTACT KPG CORP. IMMEDIATELY.” Sergeant Halway reaches for her phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AUSTIN, a KPG employee in his 30s, strides quickly down a hallway. He is carrying a FOLDER bearing a KPG logo and speaking into a Bluetooth device.

dialogues.speaker: AUSTIN
dialogues.text: Tell Fort Kenilworth that David Collins is deceased. Just give them the official version. We’ll take it from here. Austin removes his Bluetooth and slips it into his pocket as he continues down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a meeting room, a man in a black suit, MAJOR CARVER, sits at a long table across from three KPG EXECUTIVES in similar attire. One of them, HENDRICKS, is speaking.

dialogues.speaker: HENDRICKS
dialogues.text: I’m meeting with the rest of our board next week to discuss the future of our work with the military in light of Project Aegolius’ dissolution. Richard has some further information on that. Richard? Major Carver nods.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: I can’t get into too many details, nor would you want me to. However, I can say- There is a KNOCK on the door, interrupting Carver.  48. The door OPENS and Austin leans in, holding the folder. He looks quickly at Major Carver.

dialogues.speaker: AUSTIN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry to interrupt. Something’s come up. Major Carver looks at Austin, then nods, rising.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: You’1l have to excuse me. Hendricks nods curtly. Major Carver exits the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Major Carver walks alongside Austin down the hallway, rapidly perusing the contents of the folder.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: When did Fort Kenilworth receive this call?

dialogues.speaker: AUSTIN
dialogues.text: About an hour ago, sir.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: Have you I.D.ed the caller?

dialogues.speaker: AUSTIN
dialogues.text: Not confirmed, but she gave her name as Anna Peterson. Major Carver stops walking.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: Peterson...?

dialogues.speaker: AUSTIN
dialogues.text: She’s the sister of one of our nullified subjects. Caleb Peterson. Major Carver looks quickly at Austin.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: AUSTIN
dialogues.text: Home address is in there. Major Carver closes the folder and begins walking again, quickly. Austin hurries after him.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: Get me on the next flight. If we need to charter something, do it. And I’m going to need some shooters.

dialogues.speaker: AUSTIN
dialogues.text: If anyone asks what’s happening, what do I tell them?

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: Make something up. No one outside of this circle can know that any of our subjects are still active, understood? If KPG gets any blowback on this, you and I will both be hung out to dry. Got that? Austin nods.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Call me when you have a plane booked. Austin quickly turns and heads down the hall as Carver continues in the other direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pick-up truck is parked inside an abandoned rock quarry. Craig stands next to the truck, along with an older man, HIGGINS, who has tattooed hands. David walks down into the quarry, appearing over its horizon, carrying his rucksack. Craig and Higgins turn at his approach.

dialogues.speaker: HIGGINS
dialogues.text: That him? Craig nods and raises a hand in greeting; David returns the wave as he approaches.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: HIGGINS
dialogues.text: Where’s your car? David gestures behind him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I parked a way’s back. I felt like a walk. I’m not late, am I?  50.

dialogues.speaker: HIGGINS
dialogues.text: No, you’re on time.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: HIGGINS
dialogues.text: Before we start anything here, I’d like to see that you’ve got some cash on you, if you don’t mind. Craig shrugs apologetically, but David is already reaching into his rucksack. He takes out a thick envelope of $100 bills, opening it for Higgins to see.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: That should be good?

dialogues.speaker: HIGGINS
dialogues.text: Yes, indeed. David pockets the envelope. Higgins faces the truck.

dialogues.speaker: HIGGINS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Craig here didn’t seem to know exactly what you might be looking for, so I brought a few options.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Good. Higgins unlocks an aluminum box in the rear bed of the pick-up truck, raising its lid. It is filled with FIREARMS and boxes of BULLETS.

dialogues.speaker: HIGGINS
dialogues.text: You looking for a rifle or a handgun?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Handgun.

dialogues.speaker: HIGGINS
dialogues.text: Figured so. Now, some of these guns might have numbers on them, and some don’t. The prices vary, but they’re all in top condition and ready to fire. Here... Higgins reaches into the box and removes four handguns, as well as two boxes of bullets. He carries this load over to a flat rock area, followed by Craig and David. Higgins sets down the guns, laying them out.  51.

dialogues.speaker: HIGGINS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’ve got your Beretta there, I’m sure you’re used to that one. Don’t know if you've fired this before. Nine millimeter Witness Elite. Similar weapon, but I prefer the recoil action, almost no kick. Higgins hands David a chrome pistol. David opens the chamber, checking the gun, then begins rapidly TAKING THE GUN APART, checking each piece. Higgins watches him.

dialogues.speaker: HIGGINS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You army?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: HIGGINS
dialogues.text: Navy, myself. ‘Course, that was some time ago. David snaps the pieces of the pistol together, reassembling it. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It’s fine.

dialogues.speaker: HIGGINS
dialogues.text: So. You'll take the Elite, then?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Oh, I’1l take all of them.

dialogues.speaker: HIGGINS
dialogues.text: All of the handguns?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No. Everything. All your guns.

dialogues.speaker: HIGGINS
dialogues.text: You got the money for that?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No, I’m going to kill you. Craig goes still.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: Uh, David...

dialogues.speaker: HIGGINS
dialogues.text: Now, don’t get funny with me, boy.  52. Higgins reaches behind himself and pulls a SMALL REVOLVER from a holster in his belt. He aims the gun at David.

dialogues.speaker: HIGGINS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you think I’d come- David reaches out and GRABS the wheel of the revolver in Higgins’ hand, holding it tightly. With his other hand, David snatches up another revolver and SNAPS IT OPEN. Higgins, eyes suddenly wide, tries to COCK THE REVOLVER, pulling the hammer back. The wheel rotates slightly, then David squeezes the gun harder, STOPPING IT. The bullet loaded in Higgins’ small revolver is just a centimeter away from being under its hammer. Using his free hand, David grabs a bullet and loads it into the revolver without looking. He snaps the chamber wheel in and raises the gun to aim it at Higgins, COCKING IT. Higgins’ face goes slack. Craig stares, frozen.

dialogues.speaker: CRAIG
dialogues.text: Oh shit. Craig spins and starts RUNNING towards the quarry’s exit. David pulls the trigger on the revolver aimed at Higgins. The hammer hits an empty chamber. The gun CLICKS. Higgins grabs onto the small revolver he is aiming at David with BOTH HANDS-just as David pulls the trigger of his revolver a third time, SHOOTING HIGGINS IN THE FACE and BLOWING THE BACK OF HIS HEAD OFF. As Higgins’ body jerks back, David yanks the small revolver from his grasp. Craig is RUNNING AWAY in the distance, nearing the exit to the quarry, frantically scrambling up its slope. David aims the small revolver out, inhales, then slowly EXHALES. He shifts the gun so that it is pointed just slightly in front of Craig and PULLS THE TRIGGER. The gun FIRES. For a fraction of a second, nothing happens. Then the back of Craig’s head EXPLODES from the bullet’s impact and Craig falls to the ground, his dead body skidding through the gravel from its momentum.  David regards the two corpses in front of him for a moment, then stands and wipes the small revolver clean on his shirt. He kneels and places it in Higgins’ hand, closing Higgins’ fingers around it multiple times. David turns around. He collects all of the handguns and bullets from the rock, placing them in his rucksack. David then climbs into the back of the pick-up truck to peer inside the aluminum box. The box contains two single barrel SHOTGUNS and an ASSAULT RIFLE, as well as boxes of bullets. David lifts these out. Beneath the assault rifles is a GRENADE. David looks at it. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - ANNA’S ROOM - DAY - CONTINUOUS Anna lies on her bed, listening to music on her stereo. Her cell phone rings. She answers it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Hello? (pause) Yes, thank you for calling me back. Anna is silent, listening to the voice on the other end of the phone. She sits up. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - KITCHEN - DAY —- MOMENTS LATER Laura is cooking in the kitchen. Two PUMPKINS sit on the counter. Anna enters the room behind her.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Mom, can I talk to you? Laura frowns, carrying a pan over to the stove.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Sure, sweetie, what’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I called the military base David said he was just discharged from, Fort Kennilworth, to ask about him.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: What? Why would you do that?  54. Anna starts to speak, but stops at the sound of the front door opening. Spencer's voice calls out:

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, is anyone home?

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: We're in here! Spencer enters the kitchen, looking pale.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: I need a drink. Spencer crosses to a liquor cabinet and pours whiskey out into a tumbler.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: What-? Spencer, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: They found Allan, my boss. He’s been missing from work the last couple of days, and people were getting worried, so one of his friends broke into his home. Spencer takes a quick drink of whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They found him and his girlfriend dead. They'd both taken pills, I guess he had some prescriptions... It looks like a suicide pact kind of thing.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Oh my god! But that- That doesn’t make any sense. He was...

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: Totally normal. Yeah. The police are investigating. There was nothing in their wall safe, but it wasn’t broken into... but she had some bruises... I guess we'll have to see what the police say.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Maybe one of them was like, dying of cancer or something?

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: I guess we’ll find out. Spencer finishes his drink.  55.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The damned thing is, this means I’m regional manager. At least, for a while. As soon as corporate heard, I got a call. They're offering me the same salary as Allan to start right away.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Oh! That’s... Laura trails off. Spencer nods and pours himself another whiskey. He glances towards the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: Hey, David. I didn’t hear you come in. David is standing in the kitchen doorway, holding shopping bags. Anna takes a step back, startled.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I didn’t want to interrupt. I’m sorry to hear about your colleague.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: That’s okay. Thank you. Care for a drink?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Sure. I'll be right back. David exits, carrying his bags. Anna looks at her parents. Her cell phone, in her pocket, rings. Anna checks the number, then quickly exits the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna moves into the living room, answering her phone. She speaks quietly.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Zeke? INT. ZEKE’S VAN - DAY - CONTINUOUS Zeke is speaking into his cell phone as he drives his van down a side street. He is visibly upset.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Hey, Anna. I just- can you talk now?  56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna looks towards the kitchen, then turns away.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Not really. I’m at home. What’s going on? INT. ZEKE’S VAN - DAY - CONTINUOUS Zeke turns the van around a corner, holding his phone.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: It's Craig, babe. They found him out in the woods. Dead. He got shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna stares out the front windows, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: What? But- who... Do they know who-?

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: No. INT. ZEKE’'S VAN - DAY - CONTINUOUS Zeke continues talking into his phone as he drives. He checks his side mirror and frowns.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: He was with some guy... I don’t know all the details. Can you come meet me later?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna looks out the windows. Behind her, out of view, David stands on the stairs, very still, watching her.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Yeah, of course. I have something else I need to talk to you about, too. INT. ZEKE’S VAN - DAY - CONTINUOUS Zeke frowns, looking into his side mirror as he drives.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: What is it?  57. From behind Zeke, a POLICE SIREN chirps to life. Blue and red POLICE LIGHTS FLASH.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit, babe, I got to go. Call you back. Zeke quickly hangs up his phone, tossing it into the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
