dialogues.text: Anna frowns, the phone still to her ear.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: What? Hello? Anna looks down at her phone. Behind her, David audibly moves forward, walking into the front room. Anna spins to face David, startled. She looks down at her phone again, then pockets it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey. I... I’m going out for a bit.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Okay. Anna opens the front door and quickly exits the house. David watches through the windows as Anna climbs into her car and drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna enters a small, old-fashioned diner, looking around. The diner is nearly empty, with just a few customers. Kristen, wearing a diner uniform, quickly moves from behind the counter and embraces Anna. Kristen looks as though she has been crying.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Yeah. I just heard about it from Zeke. How are you doing?  58.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: I’m fine... I just don’t get it. Who'd want to hurt Craig? He was friends with everyone.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I know. Can you sit down?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: Yeah. I have to finish out my shift, but Sebastian said I can take a break. Anna and Kristen move over to an empty booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David and Luke sit out on the front stoop. In front of them, the two PUMPKINS have been placed on a layer of newspaper covering the concrete, along with two knives.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: So how does this work?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: First you make a hole at the top, so you can reach in and scoop all the guts out. Luke takes a steak knife and begins sawing a hole in the top of the pumpkin, with effort. David picks up a knife and starts to do the same. David then stops, examining the knife.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Your parents’ knives suck.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah. David sets down the steak knife he is holding, then removes a BUTTERFLY KNIFE from his pants pocket. Luke stares as David FLIPS the butterfly knife open. Using the gleaming blade, David easily cuts a hole in the top of his pumpkin.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: That’s better.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Do you carry that on you, like, all the time?  59.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: This knife? Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Just in case. David resumes carving his pumpkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna and Kristen sit across from each other in a diner booth. Anna drums her fingers, looking worried.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Something else happened... It’s kind of weird. I called the army base David said he was from. They told me David Collins died a week ago. He was in a military hospital in Idaho, there was a fire from some oxygen tanks. About twenty people died, David Collins was one of them.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: Okay, so... wrong David Collins. Common name. Come on, it’s the military.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: David Andersen Collins. The woman I talked to emailed me a photo of him. Brown hair, round face, acne problem. Looked like a nice guy. Not David. Kristen regards Anna seriously.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: You’re really worried about this?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Yeah. I am. A little. Kristen considers.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: Does David have any I.D.? Credit cards?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I’ve never seen him use a wallet.  60.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: What about his phone? He has a burner, right? Why don’t you check some of the numbers he’s called? Your brother knows computers. Have him look them up.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Yeah. That’s a good idea. Thanks. One of Kristen’s coworkers, a man wearing a bandana and GRILL CHEF apron, stops by the booth. He speaks quietly, nodding at a pair of seated customers.

dialogues.speaker: GRILL CHEF
dialogues.text: Hey, Kristen. I think that couple’s been done for a bit.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: I’ve got it. Thanks. Kristen rises. Anna does the same.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Call me when you get off, okay?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: I will. Take care of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: You too. Anna exits the diner as Kristen moves to a table.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: David and Luke carry their completed pumpkins in from outside. Luke’s jack-o’-lantern is an ornate ghoulish face, with detailed facial features. David’s is a geometrically precise, traditional jack-o’-lantern.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Do you want some advice, Luke?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Sure. David sets his pumpkin and the butterfly knife down on the kitchen table. He removes his jacket and tosses it onto a nearby chair in the living room.  61.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Never let anyone pick on you. Otherwise, you'll carry it with you forever. Those guys at school, they’re bigger than you? Luke sets his jack-o’-lantern down on the kitchen counter. He looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Then bring a knife to school. If they take it away from you and beat you up, go to their houses at night and burn them down with their families inside. What’s the worst they can do? Luke does not look particularly convinced by this.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Here. David CLOSES the butterfly knife and hands it to Luke.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Keep it. Luke takes the knife from David. He awkwardly opens it, using both hands, and then shuts it.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: You’re giving this to me?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah, man, it’s yours. I’ve got others. The front door opens in the next room. Luke quickly POCKETS the knife as Anna steps inside. David looks over at her from the kitchen, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, care to join us? Anna looks at the chair in the front room, where David's jacked is draped. She casually moves towards it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Ah, no, probably not. Mom and dad around?  62.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: They went to the store. Your mom’s going to make pumpkin pie.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: That’s cool. Anna looks up. David is setting his pumpkin on the kitchen counter, next to Luke's. Anna feels the pocket of David’s jacket, then stops when her hand touches his CELL PHONE. She quickly slips David's disposable cell phone out of his pocket and exits into the hallway, clutching it in her hands. Neither David nor Luke look at her. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - ANNA’S ROOM - MOMENTS LATER Anna enters her room and quickly shuts the door behind her. She puts some MUSIC on her stereo, a loud goth song. Anna snaps David’s phone open, scrolling so that its screen displays recent calls. Anna takes her own cell phone out and SNAPS A PICTURE of David's phone screen. Anna scrolls further through David’s recent calls; there are only a few more. Suddenly David's phone RINGS LOUDLY, vibrating in her hand. Anna freezes.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Shit. Anna spins for the door to her room, moving quietly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna rapidly crosses the hallway. She opens the door to Caleb's room, then spins back into the hallway. Anna ducks back into her bedroom and shuts the door. A moment later, David enters the hallway, holding the receiver to the Petersons’ CORDLESS PHONE to his ear. David walks down the hallway. His cell phone is audible RINGING near the end of the hallway, its noise muffled. David heads towards the sound. David stops at the door to Anna’s room, listening to her muffled music.  63. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - ANNA’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS Anna stands just inside the door to her room, not moving. Silence, then Anna can hear David’s FOOTSTEPS in the hallway, moving away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David continues walking towards the sound of his ringing cell phone. He opens the door to Caleb’s room. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - CALEB’S ROOM - NIGHT - CONTINUOUS David's cell phone is on the floor of Caleb’s room, RINGING and vibrating. David hangs up the cordless phone receiver and his cell phone stops ringing. He reaches down and picks it up off the floor, smiling mildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David closes the door to Caleb’s room and walks back towards the front room. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - ANNA’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS Anna moves over to her bed and sits heavily on it, exhaling. She puts her head in her hands. Anna’s cell phone RINGS, startling her. She looks it, frowns, then answers hesitantly.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zeke stands at the end of a concrete hallway lined with JAIL CELLS. He holds the receiver of a pay phone.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Hey, uh, it’s me.  64. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - ANNA’S ROOM —- CONTINUOUS Anna smiles, starts to speak into her phone, then stops. Her smile drops from her face.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: What...? I don’t... I don’t understand. They found the gun that killed Craig... in your van?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zeke looks up and down the jail hallway, speaking quietly into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Yeah. It was wiped clean. They got an anonymous tip or something. (pause) No, I mean, all they’1l say to me is it was anonymous. Yeah, I know. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - ANNA’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS Anna looks shocked as she speaks into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Well, you’re innocent!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zeke lowers his head. When he speaks into the receiver, his voice is thick, as if he’s trying to muster bravado.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know, but... Then they searched my room, and they found some other stuff. You know. So, it looks like I might have to do a bit of time. They haven't set bail for me yet ‘cause of that. There is a long silence while Zeke listens.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, I have a lawyer. He’s calling Kristen, it’s okay. That’s why I called you. I just wanted to hear your voice. A PRISON GUARD steps into the hallway.  65.

dialogues.speaker: PRISON GUARD
dialogues.text: Hastings, wrap it up! The prison guard leaves the hallway. Zeke rolls his eyes, swallows, then speaks into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: ZEKE
dialogues.text: I gotta go, baby. I love you. Yeah. No. I love you too, babe. I gotta go. Bye. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - ANNA’S ROOM —- CONTINUOUS Anna, crying, hangs up her phone. It drops from her hand.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Anna walks down the hallway from her bedroom, moving into the front room. Her mascara has run down her face and she is sniffling. Luke is doing his trigonometry homework on the living room floor. He glances up at Anna, confused. In the dining room, David is setting the table for dinner while Laura prepares food in the kitchen. Spencer is seated at the dining room table, reading. He looks up at Anna, taking in her distraught state.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: Anna? What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: My, um, my friend Craig died today. He was murdered. Laura and Spencer look at each other, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Oh my goodness. That shooting at the quarry?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: We just heard about that on the radio. Laura crosses quickly to Anna.  66.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: And... and they arrested Zeke for it, they found the gun in his van. But he didn’t do it. They were good friends.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Zeke? Spencer sets down his book.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Anna, but if they arrested your ex-boyfriend, it could be for a good reason. Zeke Hastings was never exactly a pillar of the community. Anna's eyes blaze with fury.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: He’s not my ex-boyfriend, dad, he’s my boyfriend! I never stopped seeing him! I’m twenty years old, I can date who I want! Spencer’s face flushes.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: As long as you’re in this house-

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: (interrupting) You know absolutely nothing about him! You don’t know Zeke at all!

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: I know he’s a druggy burn-out who started dating my daughter when she was seventeen-

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? Oh really? Anna and Spencer are both shouting now. Anna POINTS AT DAVID, who is standing by the table, holding silverware.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What about him? Everyone's best friend there. What do you know about him? Spencer opens his mouth, confused.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I called the military base he said he was from, and they said he was dead! (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then they sent me a photo of him that wasn’t him! What do you think of that? Spencer looks towards David hesitantly. Laura and Luke both look confused. David laughs.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Military intelligence for you.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? (to Spencer) Ask him to show you his I.D.! He’s not David Collins! We don’t know who he is! Spencer again looks to David.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I was part of a special forces unit when I was injured, so they should be providing a cover story to any civilians who ask about me. That’s a good thing. But I did get my dog tags back. They’re right here. David sets down the forks in his hand. He reaches into his pants pocket and hands a pair of METAL DOG TAGS to Spencer, who looks at them. They bear the name “COLLINS, DAVID ANDERSEN.”

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t like to wear them because, I don’t know. I like having them with me, though. As for my I.D., I don’t have a current license, but I’ve got my documents in my bag. Should I go...? David gestures towards Caleb’s room. Spencer shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: That won’t be necessary. Anna, I think you owe David an apology.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: No fucking way.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: You watch your mouth, young lady! Spencer stops and takes a breath.  68.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I am very sorry about your friend Craig. But as for Zeke Hastings and his crew, I have it on good authority that they’re a bunch of pot dealers! You know why they arrested Zeke for the murder? Because he probably did it, Anna!

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Fuck you! Anna turns and storms back down the hallway, to her room, passing Luke. Spencer and Laura stand for a moment, looking after her, then Spencer turns to David.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: David, I am very sorry about that.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It’s okay. She’s upset. I probably should have explained the special forces thing earlier, but we’re not really supposed to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: (sighs) No. I understand. Beer?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yes, please. Spencer moves towards the kitchen. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - ANNA’S ROOM - NIGHT - CONTINUOUS Anna sits on her bed, tears running down her face. Music plays on her stereo. Anna blinks, then turns on her phone and brings up the picture she took of David’s phone screen. There are five entries. One number appears three times as missed calls. Anna takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Okay. Kristen. Anna taps one of the numbers, then scrolls through her contacts, bringing up “CRAIG.” Craig’s number matches the last number that called David’s phone.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Craig...  69. Anna goes back to the photo. Only one number remains. Anna frowns at it, then opens up her netbook. She punches the phone number into an internet search page. There is a soft KNOCK on Anna’s door.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? The door opens and DAVID steps inside, shutting the door. Anna quickly SHUTS HER NETBOOK, turning to face him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Hey. David crosses the room and sits down on the floor, facing Anna. She does not move.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just wanted to say how sorry I am about Craig. He seemed like a really cool guy. Anna says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And Zeke getting arrested... Again. I’m very sorry. Anna again says nothing. David looks around the room.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know you don’t need me here in this stressful time. I’m not helping you, which is a shame, because I’d promised your brother Caleb I’d do anything I could to help your family. But just so you know, I'll be moving on in two days. So, you don’t have to put up with me much longer. Okay? Anna does not respond. David leans forward.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Good. David leans back. He looks over at the stereo. On top of the stereo is the CD with “MIX FOR DAVID” scrawled on it.  70. David smiles, reaching for the CD.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is this the CD you made me?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Uh. Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Is it done? Anna nods. David rises, holding the mix CD.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thank you. I can’t wait to listen to it. Anna says nothing. David crosses to the door.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sure you'll feel better about this whole thing soon, when you get some perspective on it. Anna does not respond. David exits the room, closing the door behind him. Anna waits a moment, then quickly moves to her door and LOCKS IT, her hands trembling. She sits back on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Major Carver emerges from an elevator into a dimly lit parking garage, carrying a small suitcase. He is holding his phone with his other hand, rapidly SPEAKING into it.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: I want every contractor within a hundred mile radius. I don’t care where they come from, KPG, ex-military or whatever. I need a team mobilized by the time I land. Major Carver briefly listens to the phone as he crosses over to his car.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I‘ll give them the necessary mission specs in person. We can’t risk a leak on this. Major Carver hangs up the phone as he climbs into his car. He starts its engine and drives out of the garage.  71. INT. ANNA’S CAR - MORNING - THE NEXT DAY Anna drives. In the passenger seat, Luke examines her phone.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: You took a picture of David’s phone?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Yeah. I paid for a reverse directory thing to look that number up online. It said it’s the unlisted landline of this doctor in Miami. His name’s Peter Boddington. Except he’s not a doctor anymore. He got his license taken away two years ago when he performed a face lift on this lady while he was drunk. Luke hands Anna’s phone back to her.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: So David knows the guy? Maybe it’s his uncle or something?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: That's what I want to find out.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: So what do you need me to do?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I need to talk to the police. The cops found those drugs in Zeke’s room and assume they’ve got their guy. The investigation’s closed. Zeke’s lawyer is telling him to take a plea. Luke looks mildly suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: To get them to reopen it, I need all the information I can get. You remember how you stole a password for that database to do research on your paper last year?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I got in trouble when I told dad about it.  72.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Well, do something like that again. Find out anything you can about this guy. Luke looks pensive.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Do you really think David killed Craig and that other guy? Anna steers the car down the country road.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Yeah. I do.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Okay. I’1l see if I can find anything. A lot of arrest reports are public record, I’1ll check those first.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Thank you, Luke. I’1l be at the diner all day, so just call me on my cell if you find anything. Luke nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke walks into a full classroom. He moves down an aisle in between the rows of desks, his head lowered. Luke sits at an empty desk and immediately takes out his netbook, opening it to an internet browser. JASON is seated behind Luke. He has a BANDAGE over his NOSE and his face is BRUISED. Jason regards Luke balefully, then reaches and POKES LUKE WITH HIS PENCIL. Luke exhales but says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: Hey, faggot. Luke does not respond, typing into his netbook. Jason takes out a pencil sharpener and begins meticulously SHARPENING his pencil. Jason looks over Luke’s shoulder. Luke’s browser window is open to a news story. The headline reads “DISGRACED PLASTIC SURGEON TO PAY $2 MILLION IN DAMAGES.” Jason jabs Luke in the back with the sharpened pencil.  73.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, what's that? You looking for someone to do your sex change operation? Luke turns around and PUNCHES JASON IN HIS FACE. The punch is quick but largely ineffective. The classroom explodes with surprise, several students standing to look. Jason, startled, reels back in his seat. Then he flushes with rage and stands up.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You little bitch- Jason grabs Luke with one hand, PULLING HIM UP OUT OF HIS SEAT, and PUNCHES HIM with the other. Luke staggers back, falling to land right near a chalkboard at the back of the room. There is a wooden YARDSTICK leaning against the wall next to him. Jason touches his bruised face where Luke hit him, then furiously strides forward. The YARDSTICK, swung by Luke, catches Jason across the MIDDLE OF HIS FACE. It breaks in half, splinters flying everywhere. Jason STUMBLES BACK, holding his injured face. He YELLS with pain. Luke stands at the back of the classroom, holding the remains of the shattered yardstick, catching his breath. He smiles slightly. INT. HIGH SCHOOL - SECRETARY’S OFFICE - DAY - LATER Luke sits in an outside waiting area adjoining the school principal’s office. A disapproving SECRETARY glares at him from across her desk. Luke stares at the floor. The door opens and Laura enters, with David. Laura immediately crosses to Luke. David follows.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Luke nods.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I’m fine. The secretary addresses Laura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Peterson?

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Yes, that’s right.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: Mister Alston will see you now. Please step inside. Laura looks at David.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Just a second. David kneels down in front of Luke.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: This kid called me a faggot, so I broke a yardstick on his face.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Okay. Did you hurt him? Luke uncomfortably shrugs. David smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Awesome. No problem. David rises and turns to Laura.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’‘1l go in with you. David and Laura enter the principal’s office. INT. HIGH SCHOOL - PRINCIPAL’S OFFICE - DAY - CONTINUOUS Mr. Alston addresses Laura and David. Laura looks extremely upset. David appears calm.

dialogues.speaker: MR. ALSTON
dialogues.text: Due to our school’s zero tolerance policy on violence, I’m afraid we have no choice but to expel your son. That’s pending the decision of the board, but I’m afraid it’s fairly certain.

dialogues.speaker: MR. ALSTON
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What did the kid call him? Mr. Alston pauses.

dialogues.speaker: MR. ALSTON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: The kid, you know, what’s-his-name that Luke hit in the face. What did he call Luke?

dialogues.speaker: MR. ALSTON
dialogues.text: I don’t-

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Did he call him a faggot? Mr. Alston looks uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: MR. ALSTON
dialogues.text: I believe that’s what was said, yes. But that’s no excuse-

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: So that makes it a hate crime. Mr. Alston is silent for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: MR. ALSTON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: A hate crime. And I’d like to know how many others have been perpetrated against her son under your watch. A gay student targeted with physical violence finally defends himself, and you're... what? Suspending him?

dialogues.speaker: MR. ALSTON
dialogues.text: (hesitates) We could consider suspension...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No. You couldn't. I’1l be interested to see what the board thinks of you when this is front of the entire country. Not to mention our lawyers. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Laura) Do you want to sue them? Laura is totally frozen.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: I... I don’t...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (to Mr. Alston) We’re suing you and the school board. David rises to his feet, pulling Laura with him. Mr. Alston addresses them desperately.

dialogues.speaker: MR. ALSTON
dialogues.text: I didn’t even know he was gay! David just shakes his head, moving towards the door. MR. ALSTON (CONT’D) What about after school detention? David stops moving.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: For how long?

dialogues.speaker: MR. ALSTON
dialogues.text: A month? David considers, then nods.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: That seems fair.

dialogues.speaker: MR. ALSTON
dialogues.text: After school detention. We’1ll put him to work helping the prom committee set up for the fall dance.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We’ll agree to that. But I do not want to hear anything further about this young man being harassed. We understand each other?

dialogues.speaker: MR. ALSTON
dialogues.text: I think we do, Mister... Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’m a friend of the family. Good day.  77. David exits, pulling Laura with him out of the principal's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David and Laura walk up to Luke, who is still seated miserably in the secretary's office. David points at him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: After school detention for a month.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: That’s it?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah. David holds out his palm. Luke hesitates, then slaps it. David turns the slap into a quick fist bump.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See you later. As David turns to leave, Luke suddenly rises to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: David? Can I talk to you for a second?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Okay. Luke glances over at Laura, who still looks somewhat dazed. David turns to Laura.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m going to step out into the hall with Luke for a moment, if that’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Oh. Certainly. David and Luke exit the secretary's office, out into the hall. Laura sits down in the seat Luke just vacated. The secretary glares at her. Laura does not notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David and Luke speak quietly, leaning up against a row of lockers in the deserted hallway.  78.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: So, she thinks you killed Craig. And she’s trying to make a case to the police, so they’1l let her boyfriend go.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Anna told you all this?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah. David smiles, as if mildly amused.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Do you think I killed Craig?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: (shrugs) I don’t care. But that’s why she wanted me to check out that plastic surgeon in Florida. She wanted to know what the connection was there.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah, why would I need a plastic surgeon?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: To change your appearance. Like, the bones in your face. And maybe scar up your fingers so you don’t have prints. David stops smiling.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean, at least that’s what I figured. I know you’re not really David Collins, I looked him up right after Anna said that. So, maybe you don’t want people to know who you are. A surgeon who would do that sort of thing is probably pretty rare. I mean, there’s probably rules against it. But that doctor, well, I guess he needs the money, so he’d do that kind of work.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: That’s an interesting theory.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I’m not going to tell anyone about it. And no one will believe Anna. She doesn’t have anything against you. You killed dad's boss too, right? David says nothing, regarding Luke curiously.  79.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t care. I’m not going say anything.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Because we’re friends. David blinks at Luke.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah. Of course we are. Luke smiles.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Okay. I just wanted you to know.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Did Anna tell anyone else about this?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: I’m not sure. Her friend Kristen, maybe?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Okay. Thank you. David walks back towards the office, his face blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David drives Laura’s SUV, with her in the passenger seat. He is frowning slightly. Laura stares straight ahead, through the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: That was an... eye-opening meeting for me. I’m sorry I wasn’t of more help.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (distracted) Oh, no problem.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: I... I guess I just realized that I don’t know my own son very well. I haven’t been paying much attention to him. That he’s... homosexual... It doesn’t change anything, of course.  80. Laura looks to David for a response. David drives as if not really listening.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I guess I should talk to Luke when he comes home. Make sure he knows he can tell us anything. That we’1ll love him no matter what. Do you think... do you think that’s a good idea? To talk to him?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sounds like a solid plan.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Yes. I think we haven’t been talking enough. (pause) I really have to thank you, David. I don’t know what we would have done if you weren’t here. Not just today, with Luke, but... everything. I’m very grateful.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Really, Mrs. Peterson. It’s no problem. They continue to drive in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura, a clothespin held between her lips, hangs a white sheet out on a clothesline. Several more sheets and articles of clothing are already hung. David stands beside Laura, holding a laundry basket. He hands her a towel, the last item in the basket.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’ll go get the rest.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Okay. Thank you, David. David nods and walks through the yard, towards the rear of the house, carrying the laundry basket. Laura clips the towel to the clothesline by its corners, straightening it. She then looks behind her. Two large, BLACK SUVs are pulling into the DRIVEWAY of the Petersons’ house. Laura regards this, puzzled.  81. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - LAUNDRY AREA - DAY -— CONTINUOUS David removes clothes from the washing machine, piling them into the laundry basket. David suddenly straightens, as if listening to something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laura watches as the two black SUVs come to a stop in front of the house. The doors to both SUVs open and SEVEN MEN in MILITARY POLICE UNIFORMS climb out. The passenger in the first SUV is a weathered looking man; this is MAJOR CARVER. The seven men approach Laura, fanning out in their formation. She looks at them, confused.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: Excuse me, ma’‘am. Are you Anna Peterson?

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: No, she’s working at the diner... I’m her mother. What’s she done? The Major shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: No, it’s fine, ma’am. Your daughter, she put in a phone call to Fort Kennilworth a couple of days ago asking about a man named David Collins.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: (puzzled) That's right, she did. The Major nods to the man next to him, who hands him a manila envelope. The Major removes a PHOTOGRAPH of DAVID. In the photo, David is slightly younger, his head shaved on one side, and is wearing a hospital gown. He stares blankly into the camera. Major Carver shows the photo to Laura. He looks tired.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: You wouldn’t happen to have seen anyone resembling this man, would you? Laura nods at the photo, frowning.  82.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Yes, that’s David. He- At that moment, David comes out from behind the house, carrying the laundry basked filled with clothing. David stops moving when he sees the seven men. The seven military policemen stare at David in wide-eyed shock, Major Carver's mouth agape. Then they all REACH FOR THE GUNS IN THEIR HOLSTERS, the DRIVER of the first SUV fumbling for his.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: Get him! As the military policemen all STEP FORWARD, David drops the laundry basket and PULLS A PISTOL out from the back of his waistband.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Oh, shit- The driver is closest to David; David SHOOTS THE DRIVER TWICE in the NECK. The driver's BLOOD sprays across the white sheet Laura just hung as he falls back. Laura SCREAMS AND RUNS for the house, just as three of the M.P.s OPEN FIRE at David. David RETURNS FIRE, RUNNING towards the house just as Laura disappears through the front door. David SHOOTS ANOTHER of the M.P.s as he RUNS, hitting him in the head. The M.P. drops to the ground, dead. David's GUN CLICKS EMPTY just as he reaches the window to Caleb's bedroom. He LEAPS THROUGH THE WINDOW, shattering the glass with his arms. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - CALEB’S ROOM - DAY -— CONTINUOUS David crashes into Caleb’s bedroom, rolling OVER THE BED and landing in a crouch behind it. Outside, the remaining M.P.s target the broken window of the bedroom, all of them firing, SPRAYING its interior with bullets. David glances down. He has a BULLET WOUND in his left arm. Blood soaks the fabric of his shirt.  83. David reaches under the bed, grabbing a white T-shirt and TEARING AWAY a strip of fabric with his TEETH. BULLETS continue to spray the wall above David and the bed in front of him. He loops the strip over his arm, then tugs it TIGHT, creating a BANDAGE OVER THE WOUND. Caleb's trophies and framed photos are shattered by bullets as the M.P.s fire into the room. Dust and debris rain down on David as he REACHES UNDER THE BED. There is a pause in the fire from outside. The next instant, one of the M.P.s appears outside the shattered window, aiming his rifle in at David. David RISES with the ASSAULT RIFLE he stole from Higgins in his hands. He OPENS FIRE, spraying the M.P. outside the window with BULLETS. Blood bursts from the M.P.’s neck and face as he falls back into the front yard. David's rifle CLICKS EMPTY. From outside, Major Carver can be heard screaming.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Get him! Don’t let him get away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the M.P.s spins away from the open trunk of one of the SUVs, holding an M249 MACHINE GUN. He BRACES IT against the short WALL surrounding the Peterson’s home. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - CALEB’S ROOM - DAY - CONTINUOUS David drops the rifle and grabs his DUFFEL BAG. He turns and RUNS out of the bedroom, entering the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David runs into the hallway, moving to pass the open doorway to Anna’s bedroom. As he does so, the window in Anna’s bedroom SHATTERS with GUNSHOTS.  84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Major Carver delivers covering fire through Anna's bedroom window while two of the M.P.s move to either side of the window. The remaining gunner M.P. loads an AMMUNITION BELT into the M249. Major Carver pauses in his fire, nodding to the two M.P.s at the house. One of the M.P.s steps into the window. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - ANNA’S ROOM - DAY - CONTINUOUS The M.P. climbs in through Anna’s window, his partner remaining outside, gun at the ready. The M.P. steps into Anna’s room, looking around. The room is SILENT except for debris and broken glass occasionally dropping to the floor. The M.P. holds up his hand and gestures forward, indicating for his partner to follow him inside. The second M.P. steps in through the window as the first M.P. shifts forward. There is the BOOM of a SHOTGUN BLAST and the first M.P.’s ankle EXPLODES. He crumples to the floor with a SCREAM and is promptly SHOT IN THE FACE, silencing him. The second M.P. pivots and opens fire with his automatic rifle, SPRAYING ANNA’S BED with BULLETS. As he does so, David SLIDES OUT from under the bed on his back, stopping right at the M.P.’s feet. David is aiming a PUMP-ACTION SHOTGUN UP at the M.P. David PULLS THE TRIGGER, hitting the M.P. in the side. The force of the blast lifts the M.P. off his feet, knocking him back OUT THE WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The M.P. falls to the ground directly outside of the window, blood flowing from his wound. He does not move. Major Carver turns to the sole remaining M.P., who is manning the M249 MACHINE GUN.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: Fire! The gunner M.P. OPENS FIRE, SPRAYING the outside of Anna’s room with SLUGS from the MACHINE GUN.  85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David crawls from Anna’s room as bullets DESTROY its door, knocking it off its hinges. As David makes his way down the hallway in a MILITARY LOW CRAWL, 5.7mm BULLETS SLAM THROUGH THE WALL above him, moving in a line towards David as he quickly moves forward ON HIS ELBOWS. Each slug BURSTS THROUGH the wall just over David as he crawls forward, filling the air behind him with DUST AND DEBRIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The M.P. manning the M249 SWIVELS THE GUN to follow David's path in the house, PUMMELING THE FRONT of the house with BULLETS. Spent bullet casings spill out onto the ground around him. The gun abruptly runs out of bullets, its BELT reaching its end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David rises and runs through the front room, towards the kitchen, still carrying his duffel bag. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - KITCHEN - DAY -— CONTINUOUS David hits the kitchen floor, skidding to a stop near Laura, who is crouched, the cordless phone in her hands, dialing a number. David glances at Laura, then spins and yanks opens a drawer next to the kitchen sink. He pulls out a KNIFE, then snatches the phone from her hands, SHUTTING IT OFF.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No. Laura stares at David. She is trembling.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: David, what-? What’s happening? Who are those men? Outside, the M249 machine gun remains SILENT. David holds one finger to his lips, HUSHING Laura.  86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunner M.P. RELOADS the smoking machine gun, chambering in another belt of ammunition. The gunner looks questioningly to Major Carver, who is watching the house intently. Major Carver holds up one hand, indicating for the gunner to wait. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - KITCHEN - DAY -— CONTINUOUS David slowly rises, peering out the kitchen window into the side yard. It is empty. He crouches back down next to Laura.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I really am sorry about this, Mrs. Peterson. I’m afraid I haven’t been fully honest with you. Laura takes this in, watching David. David looks down at the knife in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It would take too long to explain. This is not what I wanted. I wanted to help. I considered it my mission to assist you all while I was here. There were just... too many complications. Laura is staring at David, her face streaked with tears.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? Why are those men here? They're trying to kill you?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: They are, yes. If it was up to them, they’d keep me in a prison cell forever. I can’t have that. Laura takes this in. She swallows, moving away from David just slightly. He watches this. At that moment, Major Carver SHOUTS FROM OUTSIDE:

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: Just give yourself up! Come out with your hands empty and we won’t shoot you!  87. David looks down at the knife in his hand, touching its blade. Laura is staring at David with dawning horror.

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: Did you... Did you even know my son? David's gazes up at the windows and doorways.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I did. And I can tell you, he would understand what I have to do here. David looks over at Laura. His expression is blank. A look of realization comes into Laura’s eyes. She quickly turns from David, SCREAMING:

dialogues.speaker: LAURA
dialogues.text: He’s here in the kitchen! Help- David reaches out and STABS LAURA IN THE HEART. Laura stares down at the blade protruding from her chest. She then looks up at David, tears falling from her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Laura exhales, DYING. She sits back on the kitchen floor, her back against the dishwasher. David looks at Laura’s body for a moment. He then rises to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Major Carver turns to the gunner M.P.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: I’m going in. Give me fifteen seconds of cover, then hold. The gunner M.P. looks hesitant, but nods. Major Carver takes a step forward and the gunner M.P. RESUMES FIRING the M249 machine gun towards the house. Major Carver runs over to the side of the house, JUMPING IN through the shattered window of Caleb’s bedroom.  88. INT. PETERSON HOUSE - CALEB’S ROOM - DAY -— CONTINUOUS The sound of the M249 SHOOTING into the house’s hallway thunders through the house as Major Carver cautiously steps into Caleb’s room, looking around. The room has been mostly destroyed. Major Carver kneels down, checking under the bed, then rises. He moves out towards the hallway. The sound of the machine gun firing comes to an abrupt STOP. Major Carver goes still, listening in the SILENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gunner M.P. waits, holding the smoking M249 ready to fire. He scans the front of the house. The next instant, Laura’s SUV SMASHES OUT THROUGH THE GARAGE DOOR behind the gunner M.P., the car in reverse, its tires SCREECHING on the garage’s concrete floor. The garage door SHATTERS from the impact. The SUV, DRIVEN BY DAVID, SPINS BACK in the gravel driveway, its tires kicking up dirt, then LURCHES FORWARD. The gunner M.P. scrambles, trying to pivot the heavy M249 machine gun around as David FIRES a PISTOL at him THROUGH THE SUV WINDOW. David SHOOTS the gunner M.P. in the head. The gunner falls back over the wall, landing in the front yard, dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David stomps on the gas pedal, driving forward on the Peterson’s driveway with one hand on the steering wheel. With his other hand, he POINTS the PISTOL out the driver’s side window, shifting his aim to the military SUVs. Two of the TIRES on both SUVs BURST, David hitting the two visible tires on each vehicle as he steers past them. David tosses the pistol into the passenger seat, puts both hands on the steering wheel, and ACCELERATES down the driveway. Through the back windshield, Major Carver is visible running from he house, AIMING A PISTOL at David.  89. Major Carver fires as David turns the vehicle down the driveway. The back window to the SUV EXPLODES just as David again hits the gas. David pulls the SUV out onto the road, DUCKING DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Major Carver continues to FIRE at the SUV as it disappears around the bend.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: Fuck! Major Carver runs over to the driver's corpse in the yard and takes the keys from his pocket. He then runs over to one of the SUVs, climbs in it and starts the engine. The SUV begins driving in pursuit of David, slowly, LURCHING on its two FLAT TIRES. INT. LAURA’S CAR - DAY - CONTINUOUS David quickly steers the SUV down the country road. SMOKE is rising from around the SUV’s hood. There is a BULLET HOLE in the front of the car, near its engine. David frowns at this, then looks up. Up ahead, another car appears. It is SPENCER’S CAR. David blinks. He reaches over and FASTENS HIS SEAT BELT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spencer looks out the windshield at Laura’s SUV speeding in his direction.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: What the hell- The SUV swerves and SMASHES INTO SPENCER'S CAR. Spencer's airbag deploys and his windshield SHATTERS from the IMPACT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUV comes to a stop, its front end crushing the front corner of Spencer's car. Smoke billows out.  90. David looks out through the cracked windshield, then kicks open his bent door, climbing out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David walks around the SUV, to Spencer’s car. Spencer sits in the front seat, dazed. He is bleeding from a cut on his forehead. Spencer looks out his broken driver’s side window at David as David approaches.

dialogues.speaker: SPENCER
dialogues.text: David... David... What...?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’m very sorry about this, sir. David reaches in through the window and grabs onto Spencer's head with both hands. He TWISTS Spencer’s head abruptly to the side, BREAKING HIS NECK. David lets Spencer’s head fall forward, onto his car's deflating air bag. David straightens up, looking around. Both of the cars are wrecked, their front ends caved in. David sighs and goes to the passenger side of the SUV. He opens its door and removes his rucksack. David then takes off into the fields, RUNNING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Major Carver slowly drives the lurching SUV down the country road in pursuit of David. In the distance ahead of him, the wreck of Laura and Spencer's cars is visible. Another car has stopped near the crashed vehicles, its emergency lights blinking. Major Carver frowns, driving towards the accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Major Carver drives the lurching SUV over to the crashed vehicles. An ELDERLY MAN is standing by Spencer's car, looking in through his window. The elderly man’s CAR is in the road behind him, its emergency blinkers on.  91. Major Carver stops the SUV and climbs out of it. He walks over to the crashed vehicles. The elderly man turns towards him, his expression concerned.

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY MAN
dialogues.text: I already called for an ambulance... but I’m afraid I think he’s dead. Major Carver looks in at Spencer’s corpse, then straightens. He pulls out a billfold and shows his badge.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: Military police. I need your vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY MAN
dialogues.text: What? But I-

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: Are the keys in it?

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY MAN
dialogues.text: Yes... but... Major Carver climbs into the elderly man’s car. He starts it and pulls the car into a quick U-turn, speeding away down the country road. The elderly man stares after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna is working at the diner alongside Kristen. She sets a milkshake down on the counter, then moves to clean off a table. The door to the diner SWINGS OPEN. Major Carver hurriedly strides into the diner. He surveys its patrons and employees, who all look back at him.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: Anna Peterson? Anna steps forward, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: That’s me. Major Carver shows Anna his badge.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: My name is Major Carver. Military police. I need you to come with me, please.  92.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Whoa. I’m not going anywhere. What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: It’s about David, Ms. Peterson. He isn’t who you think he is. Anna hesitates, then sets down her cleaning cloth. Kristen steps forward, addressing Anna.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: Is everything alright?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I think so. I'll call you later, okay? Kristen nods. Anna exits the diner with Major Carver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Major Carver holds Anna’s door open for her. She climbs into the passenger side of the vehicle. He then gets in, starts the car and drives out of the parking lot. A few seconds later, another car drives into the parking lot. David is at the steering wheel. He brings the car to a stop in the middle of the parking lot. David climbs out of the new car. The inside of its windshield is SPLATTERED WITH BLOOD, but it is otherwise empty. David walks towards the diner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David opens the door and walks into the diner. He looks around, surveying the diner’s few patrons. Kristen, seeing David, cautiously moves from behind the counter and crosses to him. She flashes a nervous smile.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: Hey! I was starting to think I wasn’t going to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Hi. Is Anna working? Kristen hesitates. David steps closer to her, his smile friendly and charming.  93.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: She just left.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? Where was she going? Kristen takes a hesitant step away from David.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTEN
dialogues.text: I’m not sure exactly.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: To pick up Luke? Kristen says nothing, staring at David. David sighs, the smile dropping from his face.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Never mind. David pulls a REVOLVER from his pocket and SHOOTS Kristen IN THE CHEST. Patrons scream as Kristen’s body falls to the floor. David turns away and walks towards the exit. As he does so, he removes the GRENADE he took from Higgins from his pocket. David PULLS THE PIN and tosses the grenade over his shoulder, to the floor. David exits the diner, walking towards the car he was driving. SCREAMING is audible inside the diner, then the GRENADE EXPLODES. The diner’s windows SHATTER OUTWARDS. David opens his car door. The diner is silent, smoke billowing from its shattered windows. A CAR ALARM is now BEEPING in the parking lot. David gets into the car and pulls out of the parking lot. INT. ELDERLY MAN’S CAR - DAY - CONTINUOUS Major Carver drives the car down the street, Anna in the passenger seat. He is speaking into his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: What? Okay. Copy. We’re on our way. Major Carver hangs up his cell phone.  94.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: We're going to the Maplewood Barn to get your brother. The police couldn’t send a car there. They’ve got their hands full.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: You need to tell me what’s going on. Who are you? You came here for David? Major Carver hesitates, then answers.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: Yes. The soldier you know as David was one of the subjects of a medical experiment. His spine was damaged in combat, and even after surgery, he was in pain. He volunteered for a procedure that would turn off his pain receptors and allow him to consciously regulate the flow of adrenaline in his body.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: The idea being that if we could get soldiers to control their fear responses, push their adrenaline when they needed it, we’d lose less men. But it changed our subject. While we had him under study, he killed several people and escaped. He burned their bodies so it would confuse us; we thought he’d died in the fire initially. By the time we figured out what he’d done, the trail was cold.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Maybe you should have tested your procedure on a subject who wasn’t a psychopath. The Major sighs.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: By all accounts, he was an ideal soldier, well liked by everyone. He was chosen in part for his empathy levels. I don’t know. If you didn’t have to feel guilt or sadness, would you choose to? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And if you didn’t, how would that affect your behavior? Anna blinks.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I’m calling my brother. Anna takes her cell phone out of her pocket and dials a number while Major Carver drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luke stacks BALES OF HAY in the corner of a dance floor, next to a GRIM REAPER DUMMY holding a FLAMING LANTERN. Luke’s cell phone RINGS in his pocket. Luke reaches into his pocket and takes out his small cell phone, looking at it.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LYLES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mr. Peterson, is that a cell phone? Luke turns. MR. LYLES, the teacher in charge of detention, is regarding him from nearby on the dance floor. He crosses to Luke. MR. LYLES (CONT’D) Didn't I tell you, phones off? Hand it over. You'll get it back after detention. Luke shrugs and hands Mr. Lyles his cell phone as it stops ringing. INT. ELDERLY MAN’S CAR - DAY - CONTINUOUS In the passenger seat, Anna frowns, holding the phone to her ear, then speaks into it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Luke, if you get this message, call me right away. It’s important. Anna hangs up her cell phone, then begins typing on it. Major Carver glances over at her.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sending him a text. Major Carver nods as a police car SPEEDS PAST them on the road, heading in the opposite direction, siren blaring.  96.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where’s that cop car going?

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: Somebody attacked your diner right after we left it. Presumably our subject.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: Yeah. I’m sorry. It was called in as an explosion. I don’t know anything else.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Wait... Are... Is anyone alive?

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: I don’t know. It’s possible that he’d leave some wounded to keep them busy. Anna stares at Major Carver.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Wait. Where are my parents? You haven’t mentioned my parents. Major Carver grimaces and says nothing. The Maplewood Barn is ahead of them. Anna's voice grows panicked.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What about my parents?! Tell me!

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: They’re both dead. He killed them both before we could stop him. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: What? Why... Why would he...?

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Anna blinks, her eyes filling with tears.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I don’t understand. They... they weren’t a threat to him.  97.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: David has neurological conditioning, Ms. Peterson, designed to protect both him and the experiment. If he feels like his identity may be compromised, he’s programmed to clean up all loose ends. I doubt he could stop himself now even if he wanted to. It’s why we need to get you and your brother somewhere safe. Major Carver parks the car in front of the barn. Anna is staring straight ahead out the windshield. Her face is streaked with tears, but her expression is blank. Major Carver looks over at Anna.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you want to stay here, or...? Anna‘s voice is flat.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: No. I need to get my brother. Anna exits the car. Behind her, the sun is setting. INT. MAPLEWOOD BARN - MAZE ENTRANCE —- MOMENTS LATER Major Carver opens the front door to the barn, which is adorned with Halloween decorations. He and Anna find themselves facing a MAZE ENTRANCE shaped like the mouth of an enormous JACK-O’-LANTERN.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: For the fall dance, they do Halloween mazes to get in and out. You enter in pairs. It’s a tradition. Major Carver steps forward, entering the jack-o’- lantern’s mouth. Anna follows him. INT. MAPLEWOOD BARN - ENTRY MAZE - FIRST ROOM -—

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Inside the Halloween maze, Anna and Major Carver step into a dimly lit room, its walls painted RED. They continue forward, turning at the end of the room, stepping through a black plastic CURTAIN.  98.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Major Carver and Anna make their way down a narrow hallway, its walls lined with wooden slats. As Major Carver passes a closed doorway, the door suddenly RATTLES. A canned SCREAM emits from BEHIND THE DOOR. Major Carver jerks back.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: Goddammit! What in the hell? Mr. Lyles’ voice comes from within the building as Anna and Major Carver move quickly from the narrow hallway, into the next maze chamber.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LYLES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Who’s in here? Major Carver shouts in response to Mr. Lyles:

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: (calling out) Military police! I’m here for Luke Peterson. How do I get through this maze? There is a silence, then Mr. Lyles’ voice comes again.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LYLES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Left, right, right, left, left, right, left, then straight. Major Carver grunts and moves forward, followed by Anna. INT. MAPLEWOOD BARN - ENTRY MAZE —- BUTCHER ROOM -

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Major Carver and Anna enter a white room with FAKE BLOOD SPLATTERED over its walls. Rubber CORPSE PARTS and BUTCHER KNIVES hang from the ceiling. Major Carver scowls up at this.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Continuing deeper into the maze, Major Carver and Anna make their way down a red and white checkered hallway. ANIMATRONIC CLOWNS rotate back and forth in the corners, their arms pivoting quietly.  99. At the end of the hallway, a STROBE LIGHT FLASHES. Anna and Major Carver walk towards the pulsing light. It is attached to a door, which they push open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna and Major Carver emerge from the maze out onto the dance floor decorated with pumpkins and bales of hay. Dried leaves and a mirror ball hang from the ceiling. Luke and Mr. Lyles are standing near the center of the room. Luke is holding a broom.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Luke! Anna runs to Luke and HUGS HIM. Luke lightly returns her hug, confused. Major Carver crosses to Mr. Lyles, showing him his BADGE; the two engage in quiet conversation. Luke watches this.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: We need to go right now. Come with- Abruptly, the lights in the building GO DARK. A spotlight hits the MIRROR BALL above them, which begins spinning, reflecting swirling spots of light over the floor. A FOG MACHINE starts WHIRRING in the corner. The first notes of the GOTH SONG that David and Anna listened to in her car echo through the space. The MUSIC plays from overhead speakers installed for the dance. Major Carver draws his PISTOL. Mr. Lyles stares at this.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: Who else is in here?

dialogues.speaker: MR. LYLES
dialogues.text: No one. It’s just the two of us. This is-

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Where are the lights controlled from? Mr. Lyles looks up at a loft overhanging the dance floor. It is dark; no one is visible.  100.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LYLES
dialogues.text: Up there. There’s a DJ booth in the attic... Major Carver looks quickly around.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: We need to get out of here. Now. Where’s the back exit?

dialogues.speaker: MR. LYLES
dialogues.text: Follow me. Mr. Lyles turns towards a corridor entrance leading out to the building’s rear exit. Major Carver moves after him, gesturing for Anna and Luke to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Lyles moves quickly into a MAZE OF MIRRORS, using a small FLASHLIGHT to illuminate their path. The mirrors reflect the flashlight’s BEAM in dozens of patterns, each wall of the maze giving off the illusion of infinite depth.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LYLES
dialogues.text: It’s just this way... Mr. Lyles ducks around a corner, vanishing from view, although several of his reflections are still visible.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: Slow down. Major Carver, tensely holding his pistol by his side, looks back at Anna and Luke, who are following him. He moves after Mr. Lyles. Mr. Lyles’ reflections can be seen rounding another CORNER.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LYLES
dialogues.text: Almost there now... Visible in the reflections on the walls around them, a DARK SHAPE steps out in front of Mr. Lyles, CROSSING IN FRONT OF HIM. The shape vanishes. Mr. Lyles goes silent. He takes a step back.  101. Major Carver, Anna and Luke round the corner, entering the same mirrored corridor as Mr. Lyles. He stands with his back to them.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: Sir? Mr. Lyles turns and Major Carver's face is SPRAYED WITH BLOOD. Mr. Lyles’ throat has been SLASHED; his neck yawns open. Mr. Lyles crumples and falls to the floor, dead, as Major Carver raises his gun. He shouts to Anna and Luke:

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Run! Go out the other way! Go! Anna grabs Luke’s arm, turns and RUNS, heading back out through the mirror maze. A SHAPE moves in front of Major Carver in his reflections and he finds himself FACING David. David is holding a BLOODY BOX CUTTER. David's voice ECHOES through the maze.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Hello, sir. Major Carver quickly raises his gun and FIRES. The MIRROR in front of Major Carver SHATTERS, David's reflection cracking into shards just as it quickly MOVES. Major Carver spins quickly around to see David RUNNING TOWARDS HIM, down the short corridor. Major Carver aims his gun at David and FIRES as David moves to one side in an evasive pattern, CLOSING THE DISTANCE between them. The BULLET HITS David in the side, blood bursting from his wound. He does not appear to notice this. The Major tries to shoot David again, FIRING just as David moves to the side of his gun arm. The bullet hits another mirror, BREAKING IT. David SLICES OPEN the Major’s wrist with the box cutter, drawing the BLADE UP TOWARDS HIS ELBOW. The Major gasps, grabbing at David, dropping his gun. Blood POURS out from his arm as he SHOVES David away.  102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulling Luke, Anna RUNS across the spinning lights of the dance floor, which is filling with FOG. They race towards the dark maze that leads to the building’s entrance, GOTH MUSIC pounding around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Major Carver drops to the floor of the mirror maze, clutching his arm. He rolls and tries to climb to his feet, but falls forward.

dialogues.speaker: MAJOR CARVER
dialogues.text: You... you...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You’re going to bleed out in about a minute. Maybe two. Major Carver says nothing. He begins CRAWLING FORWARD through the fog, towards the entrance to the maze. David WATCHES this, then leans down and picks up the Major’s gun from the floor. The Major continues crawling away from David, creating a thick trail of arterial blood on the floor that is visible as the fog wafts around him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You shouldn’t have followed me. Major Carver continues crawling away from David, on his elbows, seemingly focused on some distant goal. He collapses at the entrance to the mirror maze.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you expected. Major Carver reaches forward with his uninjured arm, then he goes still. His eyes slowly close as the fog pools around him on the floor. David looks down at Major Carver's corpse. He considers the gun in his hand, then sets it down in the growing pool of blood around Major Carver's body. David calmly turns and walks towards the dance floor, leaving the Major’s gun next to his body.  103. INT. MAPLEWOOD BARN - ENTRY MAZE - FIRST ROOM -—

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Anna and Luke run through the dark corridors of the entry maze, towards the front door to the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaching the door, Anna attempts to open it. The door opens an INCH, then STOPS. Looking through the crack in the door, Anna can see that the door is CHAINED SHUT.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Shit. Anna turns back, facing the halls of the maze leading back out to the dance floor. Music is blaring on the dance floor. Nothing else can be heard.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Anna, it’s just David. I don’t know what’s going on, but he wouldn’t hurt us.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I need you to trust me, Luke. Come on. And be quiet. Anna pulls Luke forward, down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Anna and Luke silently enter the wooden hallways near the front of the maze. Almost immediately there is a SCREAM and the wooden door RATTLES out at them. Anna and Luke flinch away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking across the foggy dance floor, David hears the electronic SCREAM from the black maze. He smiles slightly, walking forward, holding the bloody box cutter.  104.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Anna pulls Luke down the dark corridor, deeper into the maze. She whispers:

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Come on! Anna turns right at the end of the corridor, in the opposite direction of the path she took earlier. She and Luke round another corner, disappearing from view. The next moment, David appears, turning into the corridor they just vacated. He looks around, listens, then turns towards the front entrance, moving quietly. INT. MAPLEWOOD BARN - ENTRY MAZE —- JUNKYARD - CONTINUOUS Anna and Luke hurry deeper into the maze, rounding another corner. Luke and Anna find themselves in a CHAMBER in the maze, filled with barrels and debris, designed like a JUNKYARD. There is a stack of barrels in one corner that appears designed for a maze employee to hide behind in order to jump out and scare people. A GORE-STREAKED dummy is propped in front of the barrels. Anna quickly pulls Luke towards the stack of barrels.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I need you to hide in here. Okay? Luke looks at the hiding space, then shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: What? No way. Look, Anna, David was probably just after that army guy. Let’s just... Let’s go talk to him.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Luke. He killed mom and dad. They're gone. Luke blinks. He smiles hesitantly.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: No, he didn’t. You’re just saying that. Luke looks at Anna. She stares back at him with tears in her eyes. Luke stops smiling.  105.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I... What? Mom and dad are...? Anna puts both her hands on Luke’s shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Please. Just hide here, okay? I’m going to lead him away. Don’t come out unless you hear me or the police. Okay? Luke hesitates, then nods, staring as if dazed. He steps back behind the stack of barrels, disappearing from view. Anna quickly shifts one of the barrels, further hiding Luke.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (whispering) I’1l come back for you. Anna turns and runs deeper into the dark maze. Anna turns a corner, then another. She finds herself facing a DEAD END. Hurriedly, Anna backtracks to her last turn, going the other direction, disappearing from view. On the other side of the maze wall from Anna, David walks deeper into the maze, turning corners, still holding the BLOODY BOX CUTTER in front of him. David speaks LOUDLY.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’m really sorry about this, guys. David turns another corner. A scarecrow leans against one wall of this corridor. David ignores it, calling out.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I tried to think of another way to do it. Any other solution. Hidden behind the barrels, Luke goes quiet. David's FOOTSTEPS are audible near him. FAKE LIGHTNING FLASHES from a source overhead. Moving carefully, Luke peers out between the barrels. As Luke watches, David steps into the chamber, looking around. David moves forward, holding the BOX CUTTER. David slowly WALKS PAST LUKE’s hiding place, SCRAPING the BLADE against a chain link fence that lines the corridor. He continues speaking as he MOVES AWAY.  106.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you guys hiding? There’s no point. I locked the back door. I have to find you. Luke goes completely still as David passes him, barely breathing. He watches as David moves away from him, nearing the chamber’s exit. David comes to a stop at the chamber’s exit. He looks around, then goes perfectly still, listening. Luke silently reaches into his pocket and pulls out the BUTTERFLY KNIFE David gave him. Luke holds it in one trembling hand, closed, his fingers ready to open it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on. Where are you? (pause) Luke? Come on out, buddy. I’m not going to hurt you. Inside the hiding space, Luke shifts his weight slightly, clutching the knife. David SPINS AROUND, STARING at Luke’s hiding space. To Luke, it appears as if David is staring directly at him, but from David’s perspective, he can only see the barrels and the dummy. David’s eyes narrow, peering at the hiding space. Luke holds his breath. His hands shake slightly. David takes a step forward, towards the stack of barrels. He holds the box cutter out in front of him. A CRASHING sound comes from the other side of the barn, that of a MIRROR SHATTERING. David MOVES with unnatural speed, immediately SPINNING and running back out of the chamber, towards the maze’s dance floor exit. As soon as David is gone, Luke EXHALES, gasping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David RUNS out of the dark maze, racing across the dance floor, towards the mirror maze. Thick, pale fog shifts across the dance floor, moved by David's speed.  107. As David exits the dance floor, the song on the CD that is playing ENDS, segueing to another GOTH SONG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David runs into the mirror maze, FOG FLOWING IN after him. He comes to a stop at its entrance, standing by Major Carver's corpse. Looking around, David can only see his reflections looking back at him, refracted by the broken glass of one of the mirrors in the corridor. David looks down and, with his foot, shifts around the FOG that covers the floor, revealing the pool of blood that surrounds Major Carver. Major Carver's GUN IS MISSING. David smiles slightly.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Hmm. As the fog shifts back, David's eyes narrow. He kicks at the fog again. It parts, revealing the corridor floor. BLOODY FOOTPRINTS, from Anna’s sneakers, lead away from Major Carver's body, back towards the dance floor. David smiles. Crouching slightly, the box cutter in front of him, David moves silently, shifting the fog in front of him with his feet, following the bloody footsteps. David stops at the dance floor entrance, looking around. The fog is thick, covering the dance floor, illuminated in swirling spots by the spinning mirror ball. David kicks at the fog in front of him. It parts, revealing ANNA’S SNEAKERS, which rest on the dance floor directly in front of David. David looks up. Anna is STANDING BEHIND HIM in the mirrored corridor, aiming Major Carver's pistol at his back. Her feet are BARE.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: You killed my parents. David blinks, shifting his weight almost imperceptibly.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I did, yes. In a sudden movement, David SPINS AROUND. ANNA FIRES.  108. The bullet catches David IN THE CHEST, knocking him back onto the dance floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fog parts as David falls heavily to the floor. He does not move. Anna steps from the mirror maze, the gun in her hand aimed down at David. The fog shifts back in, OBSCURING DAVID from view. Anna hesitates, then steps forward, WAVING her free hand in front of her, WAFTING the fog from her path. David is NO LONGER ON THE FLOOR in front of her. Anna spins around and is STABBED IN THE LEG with the box cutter BLADE. It tears into her flesh through her tights. She falls to the floor, YELLING in pain. David is crouched in the fog, the front of his shirt soaked with his BLOOD. He grins at Anna, his teeth bloody, then LUNGES FORWARD at her. Anna AIMS THE PISTOL at David. David KNOCKS IT ASIDE, gripping Anna’s wrist as she FIRES. The bullet hits the GRIM REAPER dummy in the corner of the room, knocking it over. It falls forward, onto a bale of HAY. Its LANTERN sends FLAMES out onto the hay. David WRENCHES the pistol from Anna’s grasp. It goes skittering across the floor, disappearing into the fog. David reaches out and GRABS Anna’s NECK with both hands. He tightens his grip, CHOKING HER. They struggle, both of them crouched in the fog on the dance floor, MUSIC BLARING. Anna CLAWS at David's hands as he compresses the arteries in her neck. She struggles, going to her knees, frantically trying to pull back his fingers. David exhales with exertion. Behind him, the bale of HAY is STARTING TO BURN, the flames filling the fog around them with FLICKERING LIGHT that illuminates David’s face.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Stop it. It’ll be over in just a second.  109. Anna stares up at David, her eyes glassy from lack of oxygen. She continues to try to pull away his fingers, but without strength, pawing desperately at his hands. David regards Anna calmly, continuing to strangle her. Anna’s hands drop to her sides. Her head slumps forward. A KNIFE BLADE STABS into David’s back, then is WRENCHED BACK OUT. David turns around, releasing Anna, who falls to the dance floor, COUGHING and sucking in air. LUKE is standing directly in front of David, holding the BLOODY butterfly knife in his hand. He stares at David tearfully, shaking. David coughs, BLOOD flecking his lips. He holds out his hands.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey. Luke- Luke STEPS FORWARD AND STABS DAVID in the chest. David stumbles back, the knife sticking out from his chest. He hits the wall near the fog machine and slides down it, smearing it with blood. David sprawls on the floor, his back to the wall, blood flowing from his multiple wounds. He swallows, looking down at the knife in his chest, then looks up at Luke, his eyes half open.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey... Luke stares at David.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You did... You did the right thing. I don’t blame you. Don’t... feel bad. David smiles slightly at Luke, then looks over at Anna, who is still crouched on the floor. David opens his bloody mouth, as if trying to say something to Anna, then his eyes close. David exhales and GOES STILL. Luke stares at David, then quickly reaches down to help Anna to her feet. The FLAMES are building behind them, igniting a curtain covering the wall.  110. Anna leans against Luke. When she speaks, her voice is raspy.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Are you? Luke nods. Anna regards Luke for a moment, then they make their way towards the dark maze leading to the front entrance. Behind them, the flames have ENGULFED the far wall, and the fire is BUILDING steadily. Luke supports Anna as she limps slightly, her arm across his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna and Luke stand near the back of an ambulance in the parking lot for the barn. Anna still has her arm across Luke’s shoulders. Behind them, the fire in the building appears to have been extinguished, SMOKE RISING from the building’s burnt portions. FIREMEN carry equipment to their trucks. The large parking lot is filled with black SUVs and police cars with LIGHTS FLASHING. At the back of the ambulance, a PARAMEDIC shines a light into Anna's eyes, then glances over at Luke.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: You sure you're both feeling okay?

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Yeah. We’re fine. A volunteer FIREFIGHTER runs up to the paramedic.

dialogues.speaker: FIREMAN
dialogues.text: Hey, they could use you inside. There’s bodies in there. The paramedic nods quickly, turning away from Anna and Luke. He jogs over towards the building with the fireman.  111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The paramedic and fireman move to join a group of emergency workers waiting outside the rear entrance to the barn. Firefighters in full protection gear, including hoods and breathing masks, are moving in and out of the building. The sound of fire deterrent foam SPRAYING is audible within. Smoke billows out from the door. The paramedic looks to the volunteer firefighter.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: What’s the deal?

dialogues.speaker: FIREMAN
dialogues.text: Guess there’s two bodies in there, both of them burned up pretty bad. One of the guys said their teeth are missing, got knocked out, so I don’t know what the deal is. Soon as they give us the clear, we go in. The paramedic nods, watching masked men in full body protection gear exit the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the rear of the ambulance, Luke leans over and rests his head on Anna’s shoulder. Anna puts her arm around him. She looks around, surveying the activity around the smoldering building. As Anna watches, one of the masked fireman emerges from behind the building. He turns his head around in all directions, then looks over at Anna. Anna notices the masked fireman watching her. She blinks, tired, then turns away, staring out into the distance, at the dark night sky. Next to her, Luke closes his eyes. The masked fireman watches Anna and Luke for another moment, then turns and LIMPS AWAY, disappearing into the darkness of the field behind the building. FADE OUT.
